Merge branch 'rumenov/rmexp' into 'master'

refactor: remove rs/experimental

Ideally dead/unused code doesn't live in the main repo. Having such code makes future migrations and upgrading crates harder.

No one claimed that this directory is [useful in anyway](https://dfinity.slack.com/archives/CH4CADCJX/p1700469123209219).

Also looking at history of subdirectories there are no changes in the last two years. Just crate upgrades. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!16216
refactor: remove rs/experimental

Merge branch 'rumenov/upppr' into 'master'

chore: upgrade prost to 0.12 and tonic to 0.10

`from_i32` is deprecated for enums. In order to make the diff smaller I used the `try_from(..).ok()` pattern in places of `from_i32`

In some situations this pattern is suboptimal but wanted to keep the diff minimal. I will suggest teams fixing it after this MR is merged. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!16169
chore: upgrade prost to 0.12 and tonic to 0.10

Merge branch 'rumenov/defffe' into 'master'

chore: NET-1330 enable https outcalls on all newly created subnets

When creating the CreateSubnetPayload we use the [SubnetFeatures default](https://sourcegraph.com/github.com/dfinity/ic/-/blob/rs/registry/admin/src/main.rs?L1277) values to write to the registry. 

Changing the default values should be sufficient to enable the feature for new subnets.

Subnets where the feature is kept disabled for now

- tdb26 (NNS)
- 4zbus ( "subnet_type": "verified_application", )
- x33ed (SNS)
- 2fq7c (ecdsa Test-key signing subnet) 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!16111
chore: NET-1330 enable https outcalls on all newly created subnets

Merge branch 'rumenov/chessepmf' into 'master'

chore: Remove the TimeSource usage in the artifact_pool in favour of consensus suppling the full mutation

Currently, only the consensus artifact pool uses the time_source to set the timestamp when an artifact is moved from unvalidated to validated. 
The timestamp can be directly given as part of the whole mutation instead of having the artifact pool do an extra mutation to the passed in values.

This way we make the artifact pool agnostic to time and it is clearer that the on_stage_change call should provide the full mutation. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15938
chore: Remove the TimeSource usage in the artifact_pool in favour of consensus suppling the full mutation

Merge branch 'rumenov/mutmrff' into 'master'

chore: don't leak the consensus time across the stack.

Ideally we have one place where consensus time is set and advanced. 
Otherwise we end-up using the consensus time throughout the stack. This can lead to undesired behaviour since the consensus time is advanced only every ~100 milliseconds. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15774

Merge branch 'tim/check-statesync-id-3' into 'master'

feat(state_sync_manager): prefer peers with fewer outstanding chunk requests

Add weighted sampling that favors peers with fewer outstanding request. This should improve downloading time since peers with capacity receive more load.

Below some experiment results.

Request rate per peer:

![Screenshot 2023-09-19 at 17.41.31.png](/uploads/5ebf6582996265719db728457a06a967/Screenshot_2023-09-19_at_17.41.31.png)When syncing 100Gb it seems to do exactly what we want. Peer `229c,e48c,a083,2c5b` are close (5-10ms latency) while `bd15,acec,12ad,a338` are far away (100ms). Closer nodes receive more requests. Below it shows the inflight request per peer. One can see that here it is the opposite. Peers that are far away have more active request handlers.

![Screenshot 2023-09-19 at 17.43.58.png](/uploads/6af58dbc23c0d9a3a75f724f22f658ab/Screenshot_2023-09-19_at_17.43.58.png) 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14875

Merge branch 'rumenov/dkgval' into 'master'

chore: remove the optimization that delays the addition of validated DKG artifact to the block

@ninegua did some experiments with/without and tunning the delay.

> After testing with 3 scenarios: no delay, 10ms and 10s delays, I see practically no difference in the verification of DKG payload. All are about 0.15~0.17s for a 13 nodes network (with 100ms artificial latency between nodes imposed). (edited) 

So the optimization is deemed not very useful

https://dfinity.slack.com/archives/CGZF2NKGT/p1697874237668839?thread_ts=1697794688.020099&cid=CGZF2NKGT

Merge branch 'rumenov/dkg1' into 'master'

chore: CON-1141 Add the starting interval height as part of the DkgMessageId key used for the in-memory poll

The MR extends the key used for the in-memory dkg pool by adding the interval starting height. 

I am proposing the change for the following reasons:
- It is consistent with the consensus and certifications keys. Both contain the height.
- It enables the removal of the DkgMessageAttribute type
- Purging of the dkg pool can be done only by filtering keys. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15259

Merge branch 'rumenov/NET-1369' into 'master'

chore: NET-1369 remove the earliest timestamp from the SEV attestation handshake

The MR removes the earliest registry timestamp from the SEV attestation version.
IMHO, the TLS and SEV handshake should more or less have similar signatures i.e. the latest registry timestamp.

Also removing the timestamp now can prevent further confusion what logic should be exactly performed inside the SEV attestation code.

I know the earliest time was added to bypass some failing system tests, however, now I see that the whole code is just unconditionally ignored.

Closes NET-1369

Merge branch 'rumenov/tlsrmunp' into 'master'

chore: Do not panic in an empty list is passed as allowed clients when TLS handshakes are performed.

The semantics of how we do handhshakes changed a bit with the new QUIC implementation. Before we would access the allowed set of clients after a TCP stream is accepted. Now, the list of allowed clients needs to be known before a QUIC connection is accepted. So creating a QUIC endpoint is much easier in some corner cases when a node doesn't have any peers. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14401
chore: Do not panic in an empty list is passed as allowed clients when TLS handshakes are performed.

chore: remove the AdvertBroadcaster

Removing it allows us to have a bit more standard interface between the artifact manager and P2P (just a simple advert channel).

Furthermore, according to the metric there have no [congestions](https://prometheus.mainnet.dfinity.network/graph?g0.expr=p2p_client_congested_adverts_total%7Bic%3D%22mercury%22%7D&g0.tab=0&g0.stacked=0&g0.show_exemplars=0&g0.range_input=4w) of adverts 

which is actually expected because transport will drop stuff if the queue is full.

Merge branch 'rumenov/rmfadsfe' into 'master'

chore: move the advert/artifact check inside P2P

Moving the check into the legacy code because in the new P2P it actually doesn't make sense.

In the old P2P, we receive a messages over TCP and we need to look up the corresponding advert from the in-memory data structures so we can connect the advert with the artifact.

In the new P2P since we will be doing RPC style downloading of artifacts such type of look up is not really necessary. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14053

Merge branch 'stefan/non_routable_ip' into 'master'

fix: force artificial timeout using a non routable IP address

The `initialization_times_out_after_five_seconds` test makes use of a non routable IP address to simulate an unresponsive peer and force a timeout in `Stream::connect`.

A non routable IP is unreachable over the public internet.

Merge branch 'inactive-neuron-v2-daniel-wong' into 'master'

feat: NNS1-2597: Define "inactive" Neuron using only the current time.

More precisely, a Neuron is inactive iff ALL of the following conditions are met:

  1. Unfunded: I.e. (cached_stake - fees + staked_maturity) + maturity == 0 . (All arithmetic is saturating.)
  2. Dissolved as of <= 2 weeks ago.
  3. Not a member of the Neuron's Fund

Unlike before, the only auxiliary information needed to evaluate this (specifically, condition 2) is the current time. This greatly simplifies the implementation.

The only "additional" function parameter in this design is on Neuron::is_inactive. This does not result in a "viral" effect where other functions in the call hierarchy suddenly require additional arguments. There is no virality because NeuronStore can pass the time from its own internal clock, and is the only direct caller of is_inactive. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15158

Merge branch 'levsha/-IDX-2949-Mark-all-but-the-last-rules-as-manual-in-macro-' into 'master'

[IDX-2949] Mark all but the last rules as manual in macro.

Macros are evaluated on the very first loading phase: https://bazel.build/extending/concepts
Because of this commands like `bazel build ...` requst all intermediate
targets in the macro, even that we most likely need the last one only.
Therefore bazel has to build or fetch all intermediate targets even
though it might have the last target already in the cache. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14615
[IDX-2949] Mark all but the last rules as manual in macro.

Merge branch 'levsha/-IDX-2949-lock-haskel-dependencies-' into 'master'

[IDX-2949] lock haskel dependencies.

Having them unlocked causes CI to rebuild and re-run haskel-based tests
too often.
https://rules-haskell.readthedocs.io/en/latest/haskell-use-cases.html#pinning 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14625
[IDX-2949] lock haskel dependencies.

Merge branch 'levsha/Compress-bazel-artifacts-on-client-side-' into 'master'

Compress bazel artifacts on client side.

They are compressed already before storing in the cache, but compression
is done on the cache server side.
Compressing them on the client side won't increase overall load (as they
are compressed anyway already) but will improve upload speed. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!13015
Compress bazel artifacts on client side.

chore: fix ownership of system-tests (missing trailing slashes)

Merge branch 'levsha/-IDX-2949-drop-hash_and_upload_-aggregating-targets-' into 'master'

[IDX-2949] drop hash_and_upload_* aggregating targets.

They were introduced as a quick and dirty mitigations to bypass
visibility restrictions, but visibility restrictions should not be
bypassed: having proper visibility will allow us to ensure that
unreasonable dependencies will not be introduced (for example no one
will be able to depend on a prod ic-os image - prod ic-os image changes
on every commit and therefore targets that depend on a prod image can't
be cached). 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!13731
[IDX-2949] drop hash_and_upload_* aggregating targets.

commits.message:
Merge branch 'roman-cketh-block-response-estimate' into 'master'

fix(cketh): increase the block size estimate

This change bumps the eth_getBlockByNumber response size estimate to
12KiB because most of the recent blocks are above the 6KiB limit. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!16129
fix(cketh): increase the block size estimate

Merge branch 'roman-cketh-retry-metrics' into 'master'

feat(cketh): expose metrics for HTTP call retry counts

This change introduces a new metric that tracks the number of times the
minter retries each ETH RPC call. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!16071
feat(cketh): expose metrics for HTTP call retry counts

Merge branch 'roman-cketh-event-count-metric' into 'master'

feat(cketh): add a metric for the total event count

This change adds a metric reporting the total number of events in the
ckETH minter event log. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!16027
feat(cketh): add a metric for the total event count

Merge branch 'roman-cketh-upgrade-event-count' into 'master'

chore(cketh): display the event count on upgrade

This change updates the minter's upgrade log entry to include not only
the instructions consumed but also the event number. This will allow us
to compute the average cost of replaying an event. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!16038
chore(cketh): display the event count on upgrade

Merge branch 'roman-cketh-withdrawal-time' into 'master'

feat(cketh): track ETH withdrawal time

With this change, the minter will record when it accepts each ETH withdrawal request.
This way, the minter can track the age of each withdrawal request and expose a corresponding metric. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15996
feat(cketh): track ETH withdrawal time

Merge branch 'roman-cketh-move-transactions' into 'master'

refactor(cketh): move the transactions module under state

This change turns the transactions module a submodule of the state
module and limits the visibility of the EthTransactions struct fields
accordingly. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15940
refactor(cketh): move the transactions module under state

Merge branch 'roman-cketh-event-replay' into 'master'

feat(cketh): upgrade by replaying events

This change implements a new minter upgrade procedure that replays the
event log in post_upgrade to get to the latest state.

Closes FI-939. 

Closes FI-939

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15416
feat(cketh): upgrade by replaying events

Merge branch 'roman-ledger-u128' into 'master'

fix(icrc1-ledger): block encoding for large integers

This change fixes encoding/decoding of CBOR blocks in the ICRC-1 ledger
implementation. Currently, the decoding fails for values in range
u64::MAX + 1..u128::MAX.

This change:

 1. Add tests exposing the issue.
 2. Fixes the CBOR encoding issues and works around serde bugs.
 3. Improves handling of Nats and Ints in Cbor <-> GenericValue
    conversions. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15622
fix(icrc1-ledger): block encoding for large integers

Merge branch 'roman-cketh-ledger-metrics' into 'master'

fix(icrc1-ledger): fix metrics panic for u256 tokens

This change fixes the panic in the ICRC-1 leger metrics if the token
pool size exceeds u128::MAX. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15604
fix(icrc1-ledger): fix metrics panic for u256 tokens

Merge branch 'roman-utils-ensure' into 'master'

chore: add the 'ensure' utility package

This change factors `ensure` utility macros from ckbtc source code into a
separate package so that other packages could use the macros.

Scope: FI-939 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15509
chore: add the 'ensure' utility package

Merge branch 'roman-cketh-withdrawal-caller' into 'master'

feat(cketh): record the initiator of a withdrawal request

This change introduces new fields to the EthWithdrawalRequest to record
the initiator of the withdrawal (and the corresponding subaccount).

We need this for reimbursement of failed ETH withdrawal transactions.

Related to FI-939 and FI-940. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15401
feat(cketh): record the initiator of a withdrawal request

Merge branch 'roman-cketh-event-create-tx' into 'master'

feat(cketh): events for the normal withdrawal flow [override-didc-check]

This change introduces event handling for the normal ETH withdrawal flow: accepting the request, creating, signing, sending, replacing, and finalizing a transaction. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15221
feat(cketh): events for the normal withdrawal flow [override-didc-check]

Merge branch 'roman-cketh-units' into 'master'

chore(cketh): use proper units for gas and fees

This change introduces proper type-level units for gas and fee values. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15233
chore(cketh): use proper units for gas and fees

Merge branch 'gdemay/FI-832-fix-response-body-pattern' into 'master'

fix(cketh): fix match pattern in case response body is too big

(FI-832) 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15246

Merge branch 'roman-cketh-events-endpoint' into 'master'

feat(cketh): endpoint for minter events

This change adds a new endpoint to the minter that fetches events from
the minter's audit log.

Advances FI-939. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15063
feat(cketh): endpoint for minter events

Merge branch 'roman-cketh-event-roundtrip' into 'master'

fix(cketh): fix u256 minicbor encoding

This change fixes a bug in u256 cbor encoding and adds a round-trip test
ensuring that event encoding is correct. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15088
fix(cketh): fix u256 minicbor encoding

Merge branch 'roman-less-chronic-pain' into 'master'

chore: remove chrono from tls validation deps

We don't seem to need this dependency, and its presence breaks bumping
the chrono version. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15043
chore: remove chrono from tls validation deps

Merge branch 'roman-cketh-deposit-events' into 'master'

feat(cketh): audit events for ETH deposits

This change introduces stable structures maintaining a persistent log of state modifications.

This change only adds audit to state transitions related to ETH deposits because the withdrawal path is still in flux.

There are no tests and Candid API yet; these will follow in the next change.

Advances FI-939. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14914
feat(cketh): audit events for ETH deposits

Merge branch 'roman-cketh-auditlog' into 'master'

feat(cketh): add audit log events

This change introduces the Event type representing ckETH minter state transitions and implements CBOR encoding for them using the minicbor library. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14739
feat(cketh): add audit log events

Merge branch 'roman-cketh-closure-test-js' into 'master'

chore(cketh): add a test for js principal converter

This change introduces a dependency on rules_closure bazel plugin to
test standalone JS code. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14662
chore(cketh): add a test for js principal converter

Merge branch 'roman-cketh-principal-conv' into 'master'

feat(cketh): add principal conversion to the dashboard

This change adds a widget that converts principal textual encoding
to 32-byte hex strings suitable for ckETH deposits. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14539
feat(cketh): add principal conversion to the dashboard
fix(cketh): compute upgrade instruction count correctly

Merge branch 'roman-cketh-dashboard-2' into 'master'

feat(cketh): improve the HTML dashboard [override-didc-check]

Overview:
* Add more details about the minted events.
* Add separators when displaying large numeric values.
* Sort deposits by their mint index, descending.
* Display rejected deposits.
* Display the events table only if there are events.
* Remove the `dump_state_for_debugging` endpoint because the dashboard replaced it. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14476
feat(cketh): improve the HTML dashboard [override-didc-check]

Merge branch 'roman-cketh-init-pubkey' into 'master'

fix(cketh): init pubkey on deploy

This change ensures that the ckETH minter initializes its public key on
first deployment. This way, the minter address becomes visible on the
dashboard even if there are no withdrawals yet. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14482
fix(cketh): init pubkey on deploy

Merge branch 'roman-cketh-dashboard' into 'master'

feat(cketh): add an HTML dashboard

This change introduces a new /dashboard HTTP endpoint to the ckETH
minter for debugging purposes. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14422
feat(cketh): add an HTML dashboard
feat(cketh): print all logs to debug stream

Merge branch 'roman-mint-cketh' into 'master'

feat(cketh): mint ckETH on the ledger

This change hooks minting ckETH tokens on the ledger to the ETH log processing logic.

Notable changes:

1. The `ReceivedEthEvent` moved from `endpoints` to `eth_logs`; its fields have more precise types now.
2. We identify deposits with "event sources" (txhash + log index) instead of simply a transaction hash. Rationale: A single Ethereum transaction can have multiple deposits if they go through another smart contract.
3. There is a new "task queue" for mint events. The minter spawns a minting task when new deposits arrive.
4. Init args require the ledger canister_id now.

Closes FI-868. 

Closes FI-868

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14181
feat(cketh): mint ckETH on the ledger

Merge branch 'roman-cketh-obsolete' into 'master'

chore(cketh): remove obsolete endpoints [override-didc-check]

This change removes obsolete ckETH endpoints: display_logs and
eip_2930_transaction_price. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14335
chore(cketh): remove obsolete endpoints [override-didc-check]

Merge branch 'roman-cketh-http-resp' into 'master'

feat(cketh): adaptive HTTP response sizes in the minter

This change optimizes the handling of HTTP outcall responses in ckETH minter. Notable changes:

* We define the expected payload size for each response type.
* The eth_rpc::call function attempts to increase the response size if the response size limit is reached.
* The HTTP cleanup query call applies payload transformation to ensure that the body is deterministic even if the field order differs across providers.

Closes FI-891. 

Closes FI-891

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14245
feat(cketh): adaptive HTTP response sizes in the minter

Merge branch 'roman-p2h' into 'master'

feat(cketh): add a binary to encode principals as ETH bytes32

This change introduces a binary converting a principal to a bytes32
types to facilitate ETH -> ckETH conversions. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14196
feat(cketh): add a binary to encode principals as ETH bytes32

Merge branch 'roman-cketh-tx-test' into 'master'

chore(cketh): add a test for signed tx encoding

This change adds a test verifying that cketh custom signed transaction encoding
agrees with the ethers-core package. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14102
chore(cketh): add a test for signed tx encoding

Merge branch 'shuo/state_machine_tests_registry' into 'master'

fix(state_machine_test): initialize node keys in the registry

The state_machine_test library displays warnings of missing node keys.
This change adds node key initialization to the state machine registry setup procedure to address the issue. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14029

Merge branch 'roman-cketh-minter-metrics' into 'master'

feat(cketh): add basic metrics for the minter canister

This change introduces a few metrics for the ckETH minter canister. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14004
feat(cketh): add basic metrics for the minter canister

Merge branch 'maciej-icrc2-index' into 'master'

chore(FI-872): handle approve operations in the icrc index

 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!13972

Merge branch 'roman-cketh-ledger' into 'master'

feat(cketh): experimental: add sepolia cketh ledger deployment details

This change updates the cketh sepolia testnet deployment information. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!13962
feat(cketh): experimental: add sepolia cketh ledger deployment details

Merge branch 'roman-u256-ledger' into 'master'

feat(icrc1): add ledger supporting u256 tokens

Outline of the change:

- [x] Build two versions of the archive, ledger, and index-ng canister:
      with 64-bit tokens and 256-bit tokens.
      The "u256-tokens" feature controls the token size.
- [x] Parameterize the test suites to run on both versions of the
      canister suites.
- [x] Publish the new canister versions on CI. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!13934
feat(icrc1): add ledger supporting u256 tokens

Merge branch 'roman-cert-state-reader' into 'master'

feat(http_endpoint): enable absence proofs

Outline of the change:

- [x] Introduce a new interface for reading certified states: the
      CertifiedStateReader. This API allows the caller to inspect the
      replicated state before requesting a certified read on the same
      state. This change is necessary to ensure the HTTP endpoint
      checks are consistent with the certified state.
- [x] Request absence proofs in the HTTP handler instead of returning
      errors.
- [x] Remove the spec test exclusions.

Closes MR-249. 

Closes MR-249

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!13886
feat(http_endpoint): enable absence proofs

feat(BOUN-944 BOUN-932): switch to new caching library, fix some bugs

* `stretto` crate seems to suck and consume 7GB+ of memory on canary under prod load with nothing in the cache (memory leak or fragmentation). Switch to `moka` crate which I tested in canary and it works nicely, memory usage is less than 700MB on average
* Don't cache non-2xx responses (maybe we should cache 4xx too, not sure, to be discussed)
* Generate two metric gauges with cache stats (number of items in cache and the total size in bytes)
* Improve cache tests a bit
* As a side hustle fix the problem with not logging responses with an empty body - this fixes e.g. 202 responses to `call` and things like this

commits.message:
Merge branch 'ulan/run-816' into 'master'

RUN-816: Implement uploading the IC config to a canister in `fees_and_limits`

This adds the following to the `fees_and_limits` binary:
- New command line arguments: replica version, canister id, and the
  private key file.
- Uploading of the JSON config to the given canister id using the given
  principal.

Note that previously the replica version was implicitly derived from the
current git commit. This has been replaced with explicit passing
of the replica version in order to give more control to the user
and to simplify future CI integration. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!16270
RUN-816: Implement uploading the IC config to a canister in `fees_and_limits`

Merge branch 'ulan/run-561-a' into 'master'

RUN-561: Increase guard region size for Wasm memory

This doubles the size of the prologue and epilogue guard regions
from 4GB each to 8GB each to make it more robust.

The performance overhead is negligible. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!16182
RUN-561: Increase guard region size for Wasm memory

Merge branch 'ulan/run-840' into 'master'

RUN-840: Explicitly configure Wasm features of Wasmtime

This makes sure that we don't rely on default values of Wasmtime
config to enable/disable Wasm features.

Another change is to collect all settings in one place instead of
having multiple functions for them.

Drive-by fix: use `wasmtime_validation_config()` embedder spec tests. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!16072
RUN-840: Explicitly configure Wasm features of Wasmtime

Merge branch 'ulan/run-839' into 'master'

RUN-839: Upgrade `wasmtime` to version 14.0.4

Release notes:
- https://github.com/bytecodealliance/wasmtime/blob/main/RELEASES.md#1404

Changes:
- https://github.com/bytecodealliance/wasmtime/compare/release-13.0.0...release-14.0.0

The embedder spec tests are adjusted for the change in `wasmtime::Val`:
```
-    V128(u128),
+    V128(V128),
``` 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!16092
RUN-839: Upgrade `wasmtime` to version 14.0.4

Merge branch 'ulan/run-838' into 'master'

RUN-838: Unify wasmtime validation and execution configs

This MR refactors wasmtime config setup such that the execution
config includes the validation config. The motivation is to
ensure that these configs don't get out of sync.

This MR fixes a wasmtime crash on MacOS due to the inconsistent
`macos_use_mach_ports` parameter:

```
thread 'main' panicked at 'assertion failed: `(left == right)`
  left: `true`,
 right: `false`: cannot configure two different methods of signal handling in the same process'
``` 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15972
RUN-838: Unify wasmtime validation and execution configs
RUN-819: Upgrade `wasmtime` to version 13.0.1

RUN-819: Upgrade `serde`

RUN-763: [hotfix] Fix a test failure introduced in 8fc94d

Merge branch 'ulan/run-763' into 'master'

RUN-763: Initialize the reserved balance limit to a default value

This MR adds a new config parameter to `CyclesAccountManagerConfig` that
specifies the default reserved balance limit.

Using that config parameter the MR initializes the reserved balance limit of
- the existing canisters: this is done in the first execution round after
  the replica upgrade.
- the newly created canisters: this is done by modifying the input canister
  settings argument of the `create_canister` call if its reserved balance
  limit is not set. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14752
RUN-763: Initialize the reserved balance limit to a default value

Merge branch 'ulan/run-752-1' into 'master'

RUN-752: Add reserved balance limit to DefinitiveCanisterSettingsArgs

This is a follow-up of MR 14596 that added the reserved balance
limit to canister settings. That MR missed `DefinitiveCanisterSettingsArgs`,
which is exposed via the canister settings.

Thanks to @eric.swanson for pointing this out. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14832
RUN-752: Add reserved balance limit to DefinitiveCanisterSettingsArgs

Merge branch 'ulan/run-773' into 'master'

RUN-773: Fix resource reservation in memory allocation

This MR fixes a bug in the resource reservation mechanism, which is not enabled in production.

The bug happens in the scenario when memory allocation fails due to
insufficient available memory after the cycles have been already reserved.
The fix is to perform the available memory check before attempting to
reserve cycles to ensure that all subsequent state changes succeed. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14825
RUN-773: Fix resource reservation in memory allocation

Merge branch 'ulan/run-766' into 'master'

RUN-766: Make calculations in resource reservation precise

This removes the over-approximation in resource reservation and makes
all calculations precise based on the feedback and ideas from
@roel.storms and @robin.kunzler.

On the high level, the MR replaces calculation of the integral
function from computing the area of a rectangle to computing
the area of a triangle while taking the threshold parameter
into account. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14772
RUN-766: Make calculations in resource reservation precise

Merge branch 'ulan/run-753-1' into 'master'

RUN-753: Add the reserved balance to canister status result

This MR add the reserved balance of a canister to the
`CanisterStatusResultV2` type of the IC management canister.

The name of the new field is `reserved_cycles` to be
consistent with the existing `cycles` field. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14601
RUN-753: Add the reserved balance to canister status result

Merge branch 'ulan/run-752-3' into 'master'

RUN-752: Add the reserved balance limit to the canister settings

This adds a new `reserved_cycles_limit` field to the
`CanisterSettingsArgs` type of the IC management canister.
The goal is to allow a controller of a canister to
set the reserved balance limit of the canister.

As a drive-by fix this also replaces some existing usages
of the raw constructor of `CanisterSettingsArgs` with calls
to the builder. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14596
RUN-752: Add the reserved balance limit to the canister settings

Merge branch 'ulan/run-752-2' into 'master'

RUN-752: Use the reserved balance limit

This MR updates the resource allocation code to actually make use
of the new `reserved_balance_limit` field of the canister.

Changes:
- Introduce new error messages.
- Propagate `reserved_balance_limit` to canister manager
  and Wasm execution. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14563
RUN-752: Use the reserved balance limit

Merge branch 'ulan/run-757' into 'master'

RUN-757: Add a metric for total reserved balances

This MR introduces `scheduler_canister_reserved_balance_cycles_total`
similar to the existing `scheduler_canister_balance_cycles_total`.

The metric is recorded in exactly the same way as the existing metric. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14602
RUN-757: Add a metric for total reserved balances

Merge branch 'ulan/run-752' into 'master'

RUN-752: Add a reserved balance limit field to canister state

This MR a new optional field that stores the user-specified upper
limit on the existing `reserved_balance`.

The new field is not used and will be used in subsequent MRs. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14545
RUN-752: Add a reserved balance limit field to canister state

Merge branch 'ulan/run-744' into 'master'

RUN-744: Scale resource saturation based on the number of execution threads

Currently subnet message and regular message execution uses
the global resource saturation computed for the entire subnet.

This doesn't take into account execution threads that are running
in parallel and may be reserving resources. A proper way to handle
it is to scale resource saturation for each thread. This scaling
has to be done both for subnet messages and regular messages in
order to keep consistent programming model (even though execution
of subnet messages is single-threaded at the moment). 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14538
RUN-744: Scale resource saturation based on the number of execution threads

Merge branch 'ulan/run-721' into 'master'

RUN-721: Implement reservation mechanism in Wasm execution

The reservation mechanism is disabled by default, so this MR has no impact
on production.

This MR adds a new field in `SystemStateChanges` that keeps track of changes
in the `reserved_balance`. The `allocate_execution_memory()` function is
modified to update the new field based on the allocated bytes.

At the of execution, the replica code applies changes to the main and reserved
balances of the canister based on the newly added field in `SystemStateChanges`. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14324
RUN-721: Implement reservation mechanism in Wasm execution

Merge branch 'ulan/run-720' into 'master'

RUN-720: Implement reservation in `create_canister` and `update_settings`

The reservation mechanism is disabled by default, so this MR has no impact
on production.

This MR implements the reservation mechanism in places that update memory
allocation settings of a canister in `create_canister()` and `update_settings()`
endpoints of the management canister. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14019
RUN-720: Implement reservation in `create_canister` and `update_settings`

Merge branch 'ulan/run-719' into 'master'

RUN-719: Implement reservation mechanism in `install_code`

The reservation mechanism is disabled by default, so this MR has no impact
on production.

The MR adds a step at the end of `install_code` execution that performs
reservation based on allocated and deallocated bytes. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!13978
RUN-719: Implement reservation mechanism in `install_code`

Merge branch 'ulan/run-715' into 'master'

RUN-715: Generalize resource usage, threshold, and capacity into `ResourceSaturation`

This MR generalizes the existing subnet threshold and capacity
execution parameters into a struct called `ResourceSaturation`.

Besides the threshold and capacity fields, the new struct also
has the usage field. It captures the notion of how much a
resource such as compute or storage is being used.

This MR is pure refactoring and doesn't affect production.
Subsequent MRs will start using the new struct. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!13952
RUN-715: Generalize resource usage, threshold, and capacity into `ResourceSaturation`

Merge branch 'ulan/run-731' into 'master'

RUN-731: Unify stable memory grow checks

This MR replaces the existing `prepare_for_stable*_grow()` with
the existing `try_grow_stable_memory()` function that is used
in the Wasm-native stable memory implementation. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14241
RUN-731: Unify stable memory grow checks

Merge branch 'ulan/run-729' into 'master'

RUN-729: Remove deallocation of execution memory

This refactors `stable_grow` and `stable64_grow` operations to
avoid undoing memory allocation. It is done by reordering some
checks such that the stable memory size is updated only once
all checks succeed.

The motivation for this refactoring is to simplify upcoming
changes in memory allocation that don't have simple "undo"
counterparts. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14171
RUN-729: Remove deallocation of execution memory

Merge branch 'ulan/message-memory' into 'master'

RUN-730: Decouple checks for execution and message memory

This MR splits `allocate_memory()` and `deallocate_memory()` into pairs of
- `allocate_execution_memory()` and `deallocate_execution_memory()`,
- `allocate_message_memory()` and `deallocate_message_memory()`.

Additionally, the MR removes the redundant deallocation of memory
in `take_execution_result()` that is no longer needed because
subnet available memory is updated by the replica based on the
output of Wasm execution (allocated_bytes, allocated_message_bytes). 

This allows to simplify logic all functions because handling of
execution and message memory differs substantially.

A subsequent MR will remove `deallocate_execution_memory()` because
it is possible to allocate execution memory after proper checks without
the need to undo the allocation. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14162
RUN-730: Decouple checks for execution and message memory
feat: RUN-681: New Wasm Instrumentation Part 3

Merge branch 'ulan/apply_balance_changes' into 'master'

FOLLOW-1187: Fix the `apply_balance_changes()` function

This fixes a bug in the function that may cause incorrect bookkeeping
of consumed cycles due to saturating arithmetic operations. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14059
FOLLOW-1187: Fix the `apply_balance_changes()` function

Merge branch 'ulan/run-718' into 'master'

RUN-718: Add a `scaling_factor` field to `SubnetAvailableMemory`

Currently the subnet available memory is divided evenly between
execution threads in order to enforce the subnet limit
deterministically.

This MR adds a new `scaling_factor` field to `SubnetAvailableMemory`.
The field keeps track of the division factor such that an execution
thread can estimate the global available memory from the per-thread
available memory.

Using this new field, the MR fixes the subnet memory reservation by
scaling it consistently with the subnet available memory. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!13927
RUN-718: Add a `scaling_factor` field to `SubnetAvailableMemory`

Merge branch 'ulan/subnet-config-owners' into 'master'

Make the execution and runtime teams owners of subnet_config.rs

The file contains config parameters related to execution and runtime. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!13916
Make the execution and runtime teams owners of subnet_config.rs

Merge branch 'ulan/run-717' into 'master'

RUN-717: Increase `install_code` limit on verified application subnets.

This MR increases the `install_code` instruction limit from 200B
to 300B instructions on verified application subnets.

A similar change will follow in the future on application subnets. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!13915
RUN-717: Increase `install_code` limit on verified application subnets.

commits.message:
Merge branch 'tim/set-user-agent-fallback' into 'master'

fix(https_outcalls_adapter): Set default User-Agent header if not set by user

Some API require the `User-Agent` header to be set and reject requests without one set. Often this response is non-deterministc and results in a `Consensus could not be reached` error which is hard to debug. By setting the `User-Agent` header to `ic/1.0`  by default (headers set explicitly by users take precedence) this is avoided. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!16172
fix(https_outcalls_adapter): Set default User-Agent header if not set by user

Merge branch 'tim/move-encoding' into 'master'

fix(consensus_manager): move rpc response encoding into blocking thread

P2P does not have any control over type complexitiy so we should encode any response data in a blocking thread.

Also moves the request decoding into the blocking thread because the less encoding/decoding done in async the better. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!16220
fix(consensus_manager): move rpc response encoding into blocking thread

Merge branch 'tim/proto-encode-infallible' into 'master'

chore(protobuf): Make proxy encoder infallible

Protobuf serialization can only fail if the allocated buffer is not large enough. This can be guaranteed by using `Vec::with_capacity(encoded.len())` which is what the convenience method `encode_to_vec` in `prost::Message` does. This MR makes `proxy_encode` infallible by using that function. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!16274
chore(protobuf): Make proxy encoder infallible

Merge branch 'tim/more-unir' into 'master'

test(consensus_manager): Add unit test for same id advert update

 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!16187
test(consensus_manager): Add unit test for same id advert update

Merge branch 'tim/bump-rust174' into 'master'

chore: bump rust to 1.74

Missed the 1.74 release by one day... 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!16249
chore: bump rust to 1.74

Merge branch 'tim/consensus-manager-unit-test-recv' into 'master'

test(consensus_manager): Receive side unit tests

Adds various unit test to receive side of the consensus manager.

Closes: 

* NET-1579
* NET-1580
* NET-1584
* NET-1586

* NET-1583

test(consensus_manager): Receive side unit tests

Merge branch 'tim/bump-rust173' into 'master'

chore: bump rust to 1.73

Merge branch 'tim/quic-data-metrics' into 'master'

chore(quic_transport): Add per handler bandwidth metrics

* Add data metrics to quic transport which collects bandwidth usage by client.
* Add duration metrics push / rpc calls per handler
* Add dashboards for new metrics 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!16036
chore(quic_transport): Add per handler bandwidth metrics

Merge branch 'tim/remove-deleted_by_peer' into 'master'

fix(consenus_manager): remove deleted by peer download stop

Currently we have a future that resolves if the peer from which we download removes the advert. This optimisation is not needed because this peer would respond with NO_CONTENT and the benefit is marginal.

Also refectors the download loop by replacing the `select` with a sequential order. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!16023
fix(consenus_manager): remove deleted by peer download stop

Merge branch 'tim/enable-final' into 'master'

feat(IC-1437): Enable QUIC state sync

 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!16084
feat(IC-1437): Enable QUIC state sync

Merge branch 'tim/consensus-manager-invariants' into 'master'

test(consensus_manager): Add invariant debug asserts

* Restructures the consenus manager such that each select arm calls a `handle` function. This allows for testing it with a state machine approach.
* Adds invariants to the manager that must be true at all times.
* Removes wrong invariant when removing node from download node set. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!16025
test(consensus_manager): Add invariant debug asserts

Merge branch 'tim/remove-select-loops' into 'master'

fix(consensus_manager): gracefully exit if peer sender is dropped

Closed channels indicate shutting down. In that case we should gracefully exit the task. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15970
fix(consensus_manager): gracefully exit if peer sender is dropped

Merge branch 'tim/state-sync-metrics1' into 'master'

chore(state_sync_manager): Add total size metrics to ongoing state sync metrics

Currently it is hard to tell from metrics how many bytes of a state sync actually went through p2p. This MR adds metrics two metrics. One for the wire bytes that actually got transferred and a second one for the decompressed size which corresponds to the bytes requested by message routing. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!16012
chore(state_sync_manager): Add total size metrics to ongoing state sync metrics

Merge branch 'tim/consensus-manager-unit-test-send' into 'master'

Adds unit tests to send side of consenus manager:

* Test that there in no limit on slot manager
* Commit Id is incremented
* Initial valdidated pool is broadcasted. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15877
test(conensus_manager): send side unit test

Merge branch 'tim/transport-router-metrics' into 'master'

chore: add handler specific metrics to transport

Adds two metrics to the transport router and updates the dashboard:

1. Total requests by handler (uri path)
2. Add handler execution duration metric. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15719
chore: add handler specific metrics to transport

Merge branch 'tim/consensus-manager-test' into 'master'

test(consensus_manager): Add testing boilerplate

Adds boilerplate test for turmoil transport test. This test p2p add the artifact manager level. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15775
test(consensus_manager): Add testing boilerplate

Merge branch 'tim/implement-get-all' into 'master'

fix: implement get_all_validated_by_filter for all clients

In the future each client has p2p instance that is generic. On startup each instance calls `get_all_validated_by_filter` to populate itself. Since the component is generic it should work for all clients. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15682
fix: implement get_all_validated_by_filter for all clients
test: mark transport tests as flaky.

Merge branch 'tim/consensus-manager-metrics' into 'master'

fix(consensus_manager): redo consensus manager metrics and add dashboard

Groups the metric by subcomponent and adds a dashboard for system tests. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15654
fix(consensus_manager): redo consensus manager metrics and add dashboard

Merge branch 'tim/transport-fixxxx' into 'master'

fix(transport): Don't hold peer state lock across TLS handshake

In the worst case we hold the write lock on the peer for 30s (TLS timeout). It is possible that p2p has not received the peer down event yet (because we spawn the connect task before sending the peer down event) and it might try to send sth to the reconnecting peer (doing a blocking_read) which can block the p2p thread. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15496
fix(transport): Don't hold peer state lock across TLS handshake
feat(state_sync_manager): prefer peers with fewer outstanding chunk requests
feat: [NET-1463] compress state sync chunks

Merge branch 'tim/quic-fix-2' into 'master'

fix: Don't return cancelled tasks in joinmap

Currently `join_next` in our `JoinMap` type will return tasks as \`Ok\` for replaced tasks. This can cause issue in downstream users because they don't expect this. If a task is replaced the result can be ignored. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14898
fix: Don't return cancelled tasks in joinmap

Merge branch 'tim/cond-compile' into 'master'

fix(quic_transport): only set udp buffer size on linux

It was reported from the SDK team that the error message caused log pollution for dfx. 

This MR only sets the buffer on linux and reduces the log level to info instead of error. It also adds a log to print the buffers sizes such that the used buffer size can be verified with logs. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14736
fix(quic_transport): only set udp buffer size on linux
feat: [NET-1538] Implement send side of consensus P2P

Merge branch 'tim/apool' into 'master'

feat(artifact_manager): [NET-1531] Propagate purged artifact to advert sender

For the work on bounded data structres artifact pool deletions need to propagated to p2p.r 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14631
feat(artifact_manager): [NET-1531] Propagate purged artifact to advert sender

Merge branch 'tim/conn-id' into 'master'

feat(quic_transport): [NET-1523] export connection id

Extends transport \`peers\` api to return a tuple of `NodeID, ConnId`  and also attaches the connection Id to each incoming request. The connection id is mononically increasing (not persisted across restarts). 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14332
feat(quic_transport): [NET-1523] export connection id

Merge branch 'tim/manager-testss' into 'master'

test(state_sync_manger): Add end-to-end state sync abortion test

Adds end to end test scenario where nodes get removed from state sync for various reasons.

Unfortunatly mockall does not provide a fallibe function to check if all expectations are met. Therefore we just advance time and afterwards verify the mocks don't panic when checking the exepecations (with \`checkpoint()\`) 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14420
test(state_sync_manger): Add end-to-end state sync abortion test

Merge branch 'tim/blockin-statesyncmanger' into 'master'

fix(state_sync_manager): Move available state into spawn_blocking

The first production state sync on a large state subnet has shown some issues in the metrics. On large state subnets during state sync it can happen that the write lock on the state is hold for minutes.

* `available_state` takes a read lock an can therefore block the state sync manager event loop for minutes. This changes moves the call to \`available_states\` into \`spawn_blocking\` to not block the tokio executor. It also spawns the sending the adverts on a separate task instead of doing it in the select arm. This avoids blocking the manager event loop.
* Metrics show that \`handle_downloaded_chunk_result\` can also take minutes (maybe needs to preallocate 100GB). This blocks the ongoing state sync manager event loop which in itself is fine. The blocked ongoing event loop should not have effects on the state sync manager event loop and therefore \`try_send\` is preferred instead of \`send\`. Using async send would block the state sync manager event loop if the channel is full. (this may be debatable) 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14637
fix(state_sync_manager): Move available state into spawn_blocking

Merge branch 'tim/fff' into 'master'

fix: Use http node record entry for p2p

The `p2p_flow_endpoints` is corrupted and has missing values. With this change p2p does not rely on `p2p_flow_endpoints` anymore and the node record field can be deprecated in the future.

(it is not yet fully decided to take this approach) 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14572
fix: Use http node record entry for p2p

Merge branch 'tim/fix-consensus-perf-test' into 'master'

fix: manual consensus perfomance tests

* Add counter canister as runtime dependency
* Only do \`block_on\` when necessary since test driver sometimes spawns internal runtime causing a panic 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14546
fix: manual consensus perfomance tests

Merge branch 'tim/enable-state-sync' into 'master'

feat(state_sync_manager): Add flag to enable new state sync

Adds a flag that allows for enabling the new state sync. With this there is only a one line diff to the RC when enabling the new state sync 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14442
feat(state_sync_manager): Add flag to enable new state sync

Merge branch 'tim/state-sync-cosmetic' into 'master'

fix(state_sync_manger): [NET-1461] Adjust parallel downloads

Experiments showed that using 10 parallel chunks download allows for download bandwidth of 1Gbit/s+ which is enough.

Also prepends protocol name for state sync handler. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14463
fix(state_sync_manger): [NET-1461] Adjust parallel downloads

Merge branch 'tim/fix-quic-sdk' into 'master'

fix(quic_transport): print error on failed buffer resizing instead of panicing

Panicing on buffer resizing may cause issues in dfx since it depends on local user OS setting (failure on MacOS reported).

This MR changes makes setting the buffer sizes fallible and printing an error message. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14447
fix(quic_transport): print error on failed buffer resizing instead of panicing

Merge branch 'tim/state-sync-manager-dashboard' into 'master'

test(state_sync_manager): [NET-1505] Add dashboard

Adds state sync manager dashboard for system tests 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14441
test(state_sync_manager): [NET-1505] Add dashboard

Merge branch 'tim/transport-bench' into 'master'

test(quic_transport): Add criterion benchmark

Adds criterion benchmark for the quic transport. Measures rps and throughput for `rpc` , `push` and `peers`

`bazel run //rs/p2p/quic_transport:quic_transport_bench` 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14356
test(quic_transport): Add criterion benchmark

Merge branch 'tim/sdfdsfsdf' into 'master'

fix(quic_transport): remove the heartbeat from the conn mananger

Removing the heartbeat should be safe because if a connection get's closed it will result in an closed connection event.

In the MR, also close the quinn endpoint before calling wait_idle. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14338
fix(quic_transport): remove the heartbeat from the conn mananger

Merge branch 'tim/enable-quic' into 'master'

feat: [NET-1429] enable quic transport

This is the first step in the rollout of IC-1517 which introduces a reimplementation of the state sync protocol with quic. 

Rollout:
- (this MR) Enable quic on all subnets. Replicas will start to maintain idle quic connections with each other. The correct working of the connection management is crucial and with rolling out quic first we can confirm connectivity between replicas. 
- Enable new state sync based on quic only on a subset of the subnet
- Enable new state sync everywhere 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14251
feat: [NET-1429] enable quic transport

Merge branch 'tim/cleanup-quic' into 'master'

fix(quic_tranport): Remove high cardinality metrics

- Removes high cardinality metrics
- Use actual length of gruezi handshake
- Use 1000 bidi stream limit instead of 10000
- Use 1000 uni stream limit instead of default 100 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14297
fix(quic_tranport): Remove high cardinality metrics

Merge branch 'tim/quic-serialize-test' into 'master'

fix(quic_transport): Make wire message serialization fallible

The default bincode configuration allows for unlimited size and is infallible. With [MR](https://gitlab.com/dfinity-lab/public/ic/-/merge_requests/14276) we limited the size in the bincode configuaraion making serialization fallible.

Also adds a test that verifies that sending very large messages fails. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14305
fix(quic_transport): Make wire message serialization fallible

Merge branch 'tim/add-dashboards' into 'master'

test(quic_transport): Add quic transport dashboards to system tests

Adds dashboards for two components of ic-15-17 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14291
test(quic_transport): Add quic transport dashboards to system tests

Merge branch 'tim/remove-encoding' into 'master'

fix: remove quic stream framing

- Removes framing used on quic streams. Replaces it with just one bincod encoded message
- Limit how much is read from stream with `read_to_end`
- Remove headers from message. Currently they are not used. We can add them again when we need them.
- I will replace tests in this [MR](https://gitlab.com/dfinity-lab/public/ic/-/merge_requests/14265/diffs) with some integration test 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14276
fix: remove quic stream framing

Merge branch 'tim/quic-metrics2' into 'master'

feat: Add more quic metrics

Adds following metrics:

- Counter for `push` and `rpc` calls
- Counter for errors in connnection handle
- Gauge for number of connections stored in peer map 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14193
feat: Add more quic metrics

Merge branch 'tim/state-sync-turmoil2' into 'master'

test: state sync manger advert ping pong with quic

Use quic transport with turmoil in state sync test to have end to end test. With turmoil we have the ability to test edge cases in the manger.

- Moves some non quic tests specific utilities to `test_utils`
- Adds simple state sync manager ping pong test with turmoil
- Adds test with where `available` adverts returns multiple adverts
- Moves state sync mocks to `test_utils` (they should probably be a separate crate at some point) such that they can be used in integration tests. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!13926
test: state sync manger advert ping pong with quic

Merge branch 'tim/return-all-states' into 'master'

fix: Advertise all available states

Problem:
There exist edge cases where advertising the latest state is not enough. In some cases it is necessary to sync the second newest state to produce a CUP for the next state.

Solution:
Send an advert for all states available to a peer. This makes sure that other peers will at some point know about all states a peer has. Since peers only fetch the state of the lastest CUP ordering does not matter.


Follow-up:
Add test that checks the ordering. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!13895
fix: Advertise all available states

Merge branch 'tim/udp-kernel-buffer' into 'master'

feat: [NET-1504] Set udp socket kernel buffer for quic transport

Increasing the kernel buffer from the default (212_992B) increases performance signifigantly in experiments.


Also includes bump to the `socket2` crate. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!13873
feat: [NET-1504] Set udp socket kernel buffer for quic transport

fix: nns: governance: remove newlines from warning log message

Before this commit our log was spammed with the following incomplete warning messages:

```
Nov 17 13:23:22 hodrf-sf36l-zfwhp-etaku-svsb6-hut5g-4tsfm-56jeh-rj7gv-lbpuh-lqe orchestrator[2730]: 2023-11-17 13:23:20.801459857 UTC: [Canister rrkah-fqaaa-aaaaa-aaaaq-cai] [Governance] WARNING: Neuron Some(
```
With no lines following that would complete the message. So it seems our canister logger only logs the first line of a message.

With this commit we see the whole message:

```
Nov 17 14:04:42 hodrf-sf36l-zfwhp-etaku-svsb6-hut5g-4tsfm-56jeh-rj7gv-lbpuh-lqe orchestrator[2730]: 2023-11-17 14:04:39.713870888 UTC: [Canister rrkah-fqaaa-aaaaa-aaaaq-cai] [Governance] WARNING: Neuron Some(NeuronId { id: 2347217038740912802 }) is dissolved, but it is not known when that happened. Thus, by default, dissolved_at_timestamp_seconds is set to None.
```

Merge branch 'arshavir/improve-git-commit-extrction-for-sns-release-testing' into 'master'

chore(SNS): Improve Git commit ID extraction for SNS release testing with NNS Governance built from working tree

This MR improves Git commit ID extraction for SNS release testing with NNS Governance built from working tree.

When the NNS Governance canister is upgraded to the working tree version (a.k.a. tip of the branch), then it's `git_commit_id` field in the wasm module metadata is full of zeros: `00...0`.

Thus, the `canister_git_version` function in testnet/tools/nns-tools/lib/canisters.sh cannot infer the Git commit ID correctly based on this information. In such cases, it seems appropriate to read the the Git commit ID from the local Git branch, which this MR is trying to automate. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15755

Merge branch 'arshavir/fix-max_neurons_fund_participation_icp_e8s-2' into 'master'

fix(NNS): Matched Funding / Assign `max_neurons_fund_participation_icp_e8s` to a more precise value

Currently, the `max_neurons_fund_participation_icp_e8s` field in SwapInit is assigned to the upper bound that is meant to indicate the maximum participation amount without considering the actual composition of neurons in the Neuron's Fund.

With this MR, we make use of the recently added `allocated_neurons_fund_participation_icp_e8s` field to assign a more precise value to `max_neurons_fund_participation_icp_e8s`.

Note that the field names are sane, as from the p.o.v. of the NNS Governance, the notion of maximum differs from that in the SNS Swap, from whose perspective the maximum is just one single value that, however, should be practically realizable. So in the NNS Governance, we have `max_neurons_fund_swap_participation_icp_e8s`, which is different from the field discussed in this MR, `max_neurons_fund_participation_icp_e8s` of the Swap.

Merge branch 'arshavir/NNS1-2570-3' into 'master'

chore(NNS1-2570): Matched Funding / Refactor Neurons' Fund

This MR refactors the Neurons' Fund to make it available from NNS Governance and SNS Swap.

Main changes:
* Split module `neurons_fund.rs` in Governance into three crates:
   * `rs/nervous_system/neurons_fund`  contains common definitions, e.g., the NF matching function implementation.
   * `rs/sns/swap/src/neurons_fund.rs` contains code for validating stable Swap structures into NF-related types (e.g., `NeuronsFundParticipationConstraints`).
   * `rs/nns/governance/src/neurons_fund.rs`  contains implementation of concrete NF operations (like draw and refund) and code for validating stable Governance structures into NF-related types (e.g., `NeuronsFundParticipation`).
* Renamed `trait FromRepr` as `trait DeserializableFunction`.

< [Previous MR in this series](https://gitlab.com/dfinity-lab/public/ic/-/merge_requests/15663) | [Next MR in this series](https://gitlab.com/dfinity-lab/public/ic/-/merge_requests/15736) >

Merge branch 'arshavir/NNS1-2625' into 'master'

feat(NNS1-2625): Matched Funding / Add new field `neurons_fund_participation` to `ProposalData`

This MR adds a new field `neurons_fund_participation` to `ProposalData` in governance.proto

The objective is two-fold:

1. We need to support NNS Governance upgrades during ongoing SNS swaps, so the matching function needs to be saved / restored at CSNS proposal execution time.
2. We want to soon deprecate the old `cf_participants` field (`neurons_fund_participation` will be the one and only structure for maintaining swap-specific data needed in the computation of Neurons' Fund participation).

The chosen serialized representation of the matching function is plane string. The main reason for this is that there are currently no clients that need to be able to deserialize (only the NNS Governance itself), so it does not pay off to have any more complexity on the Protobuf level. At the same time, a string representation allows for a high degree of flexibility when it comes to deciding which parameters of the matching function need to be serialized. A possible implementation for the serializer will contain a JSON object with a small number of function parameters that are likely to be adjusted in the near future. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15106
feat(NNS1-2625): Matched Funding / Add new field `neurons_fund_participation` to `ProposalData`

feat(NNS1-2553): Match Funding / Add new field `Committed.total_neurons_fund_contribution_e8s`

This MR adds two new fields: `total_direct_contribution_e8s` and `total_neurons_fund_contribution_e8s` to `message Committed`, so that the NNS Governance canister can be aware and perform the ultimate calculation for the Neurons' Fund swap participation.

These fields are set by SNS Swap.

Note that having both of these fields adds redundancy, as in theory the NNS Governance could compute `total_neurons_fund_contribution_e8s` from `total_direct_contribution_e8s`. However, since the SNS Swap needs to serve these values to clients, it is good to have them both in the same structure (e.g., to implement additional checks for Swap's calculations).

Merge branch 'arshavir/NNS1-2369-3' into 'master'

chore: Rename `SALE_NEURON_MEMO_RANGE` to `NEURON_BASKET_MEMO_RANGE`

This MR addresses a concern from a ToB review in which the following has been stated:

> The constant SALE_NEURON_MEMO_RANGE_END is not used by the swap canister.

This is not the case, as the SNS Swap relies on the SNS init crate to validate the init payload structures, including the neuron configurations with momos. The SNS init crate does use (what used to be called) `SALE_NEURON_MEMO_RANGE_START` and `SALE_NEURON_MEMO_RANGE_END` for the two reasons that are mentioned in the comment:

* to choose the memos of neurons in the neuron basket
* to enforce that other memos (e.g. for Airdrop neurons) do not conflict with the neuron basket memos

The effect of the MR is thus purely cosmetic, i.e.: 
1. rename the constants, avoiding the obsolete term "sale".
2. refer to the concept of neuron baskets in the comments as well as the constant names. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14320
chore: Rename `SALE_NEURON_MEMO_RANGE` to `NEURON_BASKET_MEMO_RANGE`

This MR disables `OpenSnsTokenSwap` proposals in NNS governance. This is a temporary measure to address the bug due to which multiple proposals of this type could be simultaneously open.

If someone will try to submit an `OpenSnsTokenSwap` proposal, the response will be:


Merge branch 'fix-set-counters-on-caniserts-sequentially' into 'master'

set counters on canisters sequentially in test

- Perform canister calls sequentially. This should decrease the probability of `connection closed before message completed`. As only one connection will be used.
- Separate `agent.update().call_and_wait()` into two parts (`call` and `wait`). Each part is retried individually on failure. Retrying on a whole `call_and_wait()`, if only `wait` part fails results in repeating `call` part and hence canister double increment.
- Use `retry_async` with `timeout/backoff` instead of retrying on `max_attempts`. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!16259
set counters on canisters sequentially in test

introduce retries for canister calls in BN test

Merge branch 'ic-boundary-add-request-id-verification' into 'master'

(BOUN-894) add x-request-id header verification in ic-boundary

Incoming requests to the `ic-boundary` are now processed with the following policy.

**case:**
- no `x-request-id` in the header => middleware generates a header with a random uuid
- `x-request-id` header contains an invalid or empty uuid => `MalformedRequest` error
- `x-request-id` header contains a valid uuid => uuid is accepted and not overwritten by the middleware

I fixed the uuid check to version 4, as this version is generated by the Rust `MakeRequestUuid`.
However, I suppose we'll need to tweak this in `nginx`, as it seem to generate version 6 by default. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15275
(BOUN-894) add x-request-id header verification in ic-boundary

Merge branch 'BOUN-863-increase-openfiles-limit' into 'master'

(BOUN-863) increase the number of open files limit

`Performance` system-testing of the `ic-boundary` revealed that at high rps (>6K req/s) `500` errors start to emerge.
The underlying reason is that the default limit on the max number of the open file descriptors was exceeded. In this MR we set the limit for `ic-boundary` service to some high value. The pictures below show the success/failure rate of the `ic-boundary` before and after the fix. The rps is doubled in graph, this problem [still needs to be fixed](https://dfinity.atlassian.net/browse/BOUN-862).

**Before the fix**:
![Screenshot_2023-09-05_at_11.37.49](/uploads/c66403d4f92f42c603e04796a17e2e8b/Screenshot_2023-09-05_at_11.37.49.png)
**After the fix**:
![Screenshot_2023-09-05_at_12.59.57](/uploads/8b90a0591da92402adc33e5db560bb46/Screenshot_2023-09-05_at_12.59.57.png)

Merge branch 'BOUN-841-introduce-performance-test' into 'master'

(BOUN-841) Introduce boundary-node performance system-test

This MR introduces the first `manual` performance test of the `boundary-node`.

**How to run**:
```shell
ict test //rs/tests/boundary_nodes:boundary_node_performance_test_colocate --keepalive
```
The test will execute `update` write calls on the counter canister via `boundary-node` agent. 
- requests per second: 10-400 (with step 50)
- duration of each step is 60 secs
- no assertions so far, but they can be easily introduced
- http metrics of the replica reveal that `rps=300 req/sec` is the [max throughput allowed by the nginx](https://sourcegraph.com/github.com/dfinity/ic/-/blob/ic-os/boundary-guestos/rootfs/etc/nginx/conf.d/000-nginx-global.conf?L155).

![image](/uploads/17897004bd789d1cc17b88b90c5ad423/image.png)

Merge branch 'BOUN-833-bn-image-with-reverse-proxy' into 'master'

(BOUN-833) add ic-boundary proxy to boundary-api-guestos, processing /api/v2/canister/canister_id/query

In this MR we start introducing `ic-boundary` (reverse proxy) functionality to the `boundary-node`.
We do this porting process incrementally:
- For the time being, only `boundary-api-guestos` image includes `ic-boundary` binary and starts it as a `systemd` service. Prod/dev `boundary-guestos` image will implement the same functionality, but on a [feature branch](https://gitlab.com/dfinity-lab/public/ic/-/merge_requests/13975) for the moment.
- `nginx` proxies to `ic-boudary` only `/api/v2/canister/canister_id/query` requests, as only those work at the moment in `ic-boundary`. For example, `/api/v2/status` is not yet compliant with the [specification](https://internetcomputer.org/docs/current/references/ic-interface-spec#api-status), as e.g. `root_key` [is not](https://sourcegraph.com/github.com/dfinity/ic/-/blob/rs/boundary_node/ic_boundary/src/routes.rs?L407) returned.
- For testing purposes, I also created a `testnet` - `small_api_boundary`

I ran the following test manually:
```
ict t api_boundary_node_integration_test --keepalive
```
and the journal logs confirm that `ic-boundary` processes the requests, which are routed by the `nginx`:
```
root@api-boundary-node-1:~# journalctl -u ic-boundary | grep request_id
Aug 04 09:50:57 api-boundary-node-1 ic-boundary[695]: {"timestamp":"2023-08-04T09:50:57.657691Z","level":"INFO","request_id":"843a17cc-effc-4325-8289-f0a77f9da025","request_type":"query","error_cause":"no_error","status":200,"subnet_id":"mivdn-mqkfh-kt5rd-bwbx6-zex7n-bu4an-pvusf-55adt-pvkw7-qrhjl-yqe","node_id":"xz25v-x2l5d-ifrmd-x5cfk-ntxvq-vilca-q3m6r-r4sgs-odqm3-2xowr-zae","canister_id":"q4eej-kyaaa-aaaaa-aaaha-cai","canister_id_cbor":"q4eej-kyaaa-aaaaa-aaaha-cai","sender":"2vxsx-fae","method_name":"read","duration":0.001601296,"request_size":110,"response_size":35,"target":"ic_boundary::routes"}
Aug 04 09:50:58 api-boundary-node-1 ic-boundary[695]: {"timestamp":"2023-08-04T09:50:58.145896Z","level":"INFO","request_id":"bbd3f662-5f1f-47d0-abf3-04eca5b88b12","request_type":"query","error_cause":"no_error","status":200,"subnet_id":"mivdn-mqkfh-kt5rd-bwbx6-zex7n-bu4an-pvusf-55adt-pvkw7-qrhjl-yqe","node_id":"xz25v-x2l5d-ifrmd-x5cfk-ntxvq-vilca-q3m6r-r4sgs-odqm3-2xowr-zae","canister_id":"qhbym-qaaaa-aaaaa-aaafq-cai","canister_id_cbor":"qhbym-qaaaa-aaaaa-aaafq-cai","sender":"b3gus-edhie-77egn-fejju-pt4xd-zz2pt-7v22l-rrts4-a3ebi-fcm4d-wae","method_name":"read","duration":0.003139322,"request_size":276,"response_size":35,"target":"ic_boundary::routes"}
Aug 04 09:50:59 api-boundary-node-1 ic-boundary[695]: {"timestamp":"2023-08-04T09:50:59.342889Z","level":"INFO","request_id":"6ad5eefa-c238-4e11-823b-fac1348d8c32","request_type":"query","error_cause":"no_error","status":200,"subnet_id":"mivdn-mqkfh-kt5rd-bwbx6-zex7n-bu4an-pvusf-55adt-pvkw7-qrhjl-yqe","node_id":"xz25v-x2l5d-ifrmd-x5cfk-ntxvq-vilca-q3m6r-r4sgs-odqm3-2xowr-zae","canister_id":"qsgjb-riaaa-aaaaa-aaaga-cai","canister_id_cbor":"qsgjb-riaaa-aaaaa-aaaga-cai","sender":"2vxsx-fae","method_name":"read","duration":0.003036149,"request_size":110,"response_size":35,"target":"ic_boundary::routes"}
``` 
