commits.message:
Merge branch 'abk/run-830-allow-canister-to-conrol-its-chunk-store' into 'master'

RUN-830: Allow canister to control its chunk store

There may be situations (e.g. when a canister is SNS/NNS controlled)
where we want to allow the canister itself to control its chunk store.
This will allow a canister to upload chunks to the store and then the
controller will only need to do the installation. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!16107
RUN-830: Allow canister to control its chunk store

Merge branch 'abk/run-829-add-system-test' into 'master'

RUN-829: System tests for Wasm chunk store

Add two system tests for the happy path of installing a Wasm using the
chunk store. Also add one test for the error message when installing on
a target canister that is not on the same subnet of the store canister. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!16138
RUN-829: System tests for Wasm chunk store

Merge branch 'abk/run-832-upgrade-wasm-parser-encoder' into 'master'

RUN-832: Upgrade wasmparser and wasm-encoder

Upgrade the `wasmparser` and `wasm-encoder` crates to be in sync with the versions used by `wasmtime`. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!16103
RUN-832: Upgrade wasmparser and wasm-encoder

Merge branch 'abk/run-822-charge-for-upload-chunk' into 'master'

RUN-822: Charge for `upload_chunk`

Charge canisters 200M instructions for executing an `upload_chunk`
message. Also deduct these instructions from the round limit. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15941
RUN-822: Charge for `upload_chunk`

Merge branch 'abk/separate-wasm-transform' into 'master'

RUN-835: Separate wasm transform

Move the `wasm_transform` module from `embedders` into its own crate so that it can be used with fuzzing, or other places. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15855
RUN-835: Separate wasm transform

Merge branch 'abk/run-818-account-for-chunk-store-in-heap-deltas' into 'master'

RUN-818: Account for chunk store in heap deltas

Include writes to the chunk store in each canister's heap delta rate
limiting and the subnet's total delta. Since there is now a third
`PageMap` in each `CanisterState` (in addition to the heap memory and
stable memory), we need to count the dirty pages generated in this 
`PageMap` against the limits which prevent too much new data to be
written between checkpoints.

Note that if a canister is rate limited, writes to the chunk store will
fail. This behavior is different than for regular canister messages
which just sit in the queue and to be processed later. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15742
RUN-818: Account for chunk store in heap deltas

Merge branch 'abk/run-737-implement-stored-chunks' into 'master'

RUN-737: Implement stored_chunks

Implement the stored chunks API to list which chunks are in a given
canister's store. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15762
RUN-737: Implement stored_chunks

Merge branch 'abk/run-802-reserve-cycles-in-upload-chunk' into 'master'

RUN-802: Reserve cycles in `upload_chunk`

Make sure that cycles reservation is performed for the new memory used
when uploading to the chunk store. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15642
RUN-802: Reserve cycles in `upload_chunk`

Merge branch 'abk/run-823-impose-max-chunk-store-size' into 'master'

RUN-823: Limit size of Wasm chunk store

Impose a limit on the total size of the Wasm chunk store for each
canister. This can be increased later if it's needed. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15752
RUN-823: Limit size of Wasm chunk store

Merge branch 'abk/run-738-clear-chunk-store' into 'master'

RUN-738: Implement clear_chunk_store

Add the canister manager method to clear the Wasm chunk store for a
specific canister. The only conditions on this method are that it has to
be called by a controller of the canister. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15757
RUN-738: Implement clear_chunk_store

Merge branch 'abk/run-801-check-freezing-threshold-in-upload-chunk' into 'master'

RUN-801: Check freezing threshold on upload_chunk

When uploading to the chunk store, we should check that a canister
doesn't go over the freezing threshold. Otherwise the canister could be
uninstalled with much less warning than expected. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15512
RUN-801: Check freezing threshold on upload_chunk

Merge branch 'abk/run-825-account-for-instrumentation-in-complexity' into 'master'

RUN-825: Account for Call generated by Grow instructions

When validating a Wasm module, we should take into account the fact that
`TableGrow` and `MemoryGrow` instructions end up generating a `Call`
when instrumented. So they should have higher weights. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15675
RUN-825: Account for Call generated by Grow instructions

Merge branch 'abk/run-810-make-canisterid-new-infallable' into 'master'

RUN-810: Switch `CanisterId::new` to infallable `CanisterId::unchecked_from_principal`

`CanisterId::new` returns a `Result` type, but the value is always `Ok`
so it would be better to not return a `Result`. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15456
RUN-810: Switch `CanisterId::new` to infallable `CanisterId::unchecked_from_principal`

Merge branch 'abk/run-735-implement-chunked-install' into 'master'

RUN-735: Implement InstallChunkedCode

Add new management canister message to support installing a wasm module
from chunks stored in the WasmChunkStore of a canister on the same
subnet. Corresponding changes here: https://github.com/dfinity/interface-spec/pull/219 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15150
RUN-735: Implement InstallChunkedCode

Merge branch 'abk/run-809-increase-table.get-complexity' into 'master'

RUN-809: Increase table.get and ref.is_null complexity

 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15434
RUN-809: Increase table.get and ref.is_null complexity

Merge branch 'abk/run-800-implement-new-wasm-code-complexity-limit' into 'master'

RUN-800: Implement new wasm complexity limit

 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15226
RUN-800: Implement new wasm complexity limit

Merge branch 'abk/run-734-implement-upload-chunk' into 'master'

RUN-734: Implement upload chunk

Add support for uploading chunks to a canister's chunk store. This
includes charging for the space and checking subnet memory limits. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15130
RUN-734: Implement upload chunk

Merge branch 'abk/run-787-hold-unixstream' into 'master'

RUN-787: Hold UnixStream for sandbox IPC communication

There are places where we use a raw file descriptor for the socket doing
sandbox IPC. A test was found to trigger an error where this file
descriptor was invalid, so it would be safer to always hold an actual
`UnixStream` to prevent the fd from being closed on drop. Conversion to
a raw fd can then just be performed at the call site to a libc function. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15033
RUN-787: Hold UnixStream for sandbox IPC communication

Merge branch 'abk/run-733-add-wasm-chunk-store' into 'master'

RUN-733: Add Wasm chunk store to replicated state

Adds the Wasm chunk store to the `SystemState` in `ReplicatedState`. This will be used to support installation of large Wasms. Follow up MRs will implement the IC00 methods to add chunks, clear the store and install from a Wasm in the store. These will also include charging for the storage used, counting that storage against the subnet storage limits, and counting the dirty pages against the canister and subnet limits.

This should not be merged until a release has been cut containing https://gitlab.com/dfinity-lab/public/ic/-/merge_requests/14668 because that MR will perform cleanup of the newly created pagemap files in case we need to rollback. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14586
RUN-733: Add Wasm chunk store to replicated state

Merge branch 'abk/run-758-delete-new-pagemap-file' into 'master'

RUN-758: Remove Wasm chunk store file

In case we roll out Wasm chunk store changes and then roll back, this
logic will delete any left over pagemap files. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14668
RUN-758: Remove Wasm chunk store file

Merge branch 'abk/run-732-chunk-upload-apis' into 'master'

RUN-732: Introduce chunked Wasm upload APIs

Add enums for the new IC00 methods that will be used for chunked
uploading of Wasm modules. Actually implementation of the new APIs
will come in follow-up MRs. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14575
RUN-732: Introduce chunked Wasm upload APIs

Merge branch 'abk/upgrade-wasm-encoder-wasmparser' into 'master'

RUN-712: Upgrade `wasmparser` and `wasm-encoder`

There were some breaking changes in these modules to handle the Wasm GC
proposal. These changes mean that more complex types can now appear in
the `Types` section of a module (including types which don't correspond
to function signatures). So now we occasionally need to return errors if
a function is given a type which isn't a valid function type.  Wasmtime
validation will also assert that all functions are given valid types. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!13746
RUN-712: Upgrade `wasmparser` and `wasm-encoder`

Merge branch 'abk/run-689-include-more-instructions-in-complexity-limit' into 'master'

RUN-689: Expand complexity limit

Add more instructions to a potentially new complexity limit. This change only modifies the metrics recording what the new complexity value will be for newly compiled modules. The actual validation is unchanged. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14185
RUN-689: Expand complexity limit
Revert "Devcontainer SSH forwarding"

Merge branch 'abk/run-716-disable-wasm-features' into 'master'

RUN-716: Disable unused Wasm features

Explicitly disable unused Wasm features which aren't used by canisters.
These features are already disable by default in Wasmtime, but
explicitly disabling them protects us for when they are eventually
turned on by default in Wasmtime. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14050
RUN-716: Disable unused Wasm features

Merge branch 'abk/run-722-change-rpc-prefix' into 'master'

RUN-722: Change sandbox RPC prefix

 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!13996
RUN-722: Change sandbox RPC prefix

Merge branch 'gdemay/FI-945-ensure-no-double-mint' into 'master'

test(cketh): integration test to ensure logs are not scrapped twice when changing tracked ethereum block height

(FI-945): Ensure that changing the finality of the tracked block height (e.g., from `Safe` to `Finalized`) does not lead to scrapping the logs of the same blocks twice and therefore to double minting. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!16248
test(cketh): integration test to ensure logs are not scrapped twice when changing tracked ethereum block height
feat(cketh): add hash of failed transaction to dashboard

Merge branch 'gdemay/FI-1060-fix-num-events' into 'master'

fix(cketh): fix typo in Solidity helper smart contract related to `event_counter`

(FI-1060): Fix a typo introduced in [MR-16119](https://gitlab.com/dfinity-lab/public/ic/-/merge_requests/16119) requiring the number of events to be less than `0` instead of being less than `10`.

Additionally the contract has been slightly optimized as follows:
1. The field `cketh_minter_main_address` containing the minter's address is declared `immutable`.
2. The maximal number of of events (`10`) is a declared as a `constant`.

Both changes ensure that the corresponding values will be inlined upon contract creation so that no `SLOAD` operation is needed to read their values, therefore slightly decreasing the gas cost of a single `deposit` (see [this article](https://medium.com/@ajaotosinserah/a-comprehensive-guide-to-implementing-constant-and-immutable-variables-in-solidity-4026ebadc6aa)) 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!16201
fix(cketh): fix typo in Solidity helper smart contract related to `event_counter`

Merge branch 'gdemay/FI-1056-int-test-memos' into 'master'

test(cketh): integration tests for interaction with ledger

(FI-1056): Add integration tests to ensure that transfers sent from the minter to the ledger are correct (inclusive memos which were added in [MR-15680](https://gitlab.com/dfinity-lab/public/ic/-/merge_requests/15680)). 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!16149
test(cketh): integration tests for interaction with ledger

Merge branch 'gdemay/fix-nonce-workload-cherry-pick' into 'master'

fix: ensure nonce used for update request is at most 32 bytes

(Cherry-pick of [MR-16167](https://gitlab.com/dfinity-lab/public/ic/-/merge_requests/16167)).

Follow-up on [MR-16066](https://gitlab.com/dfinity-lab/public/ic/-/merge_requests/16066) to ensure that update requests used in `workload_generator` use a nonce of at most 32 bytes. The previously used nonce was some bytes derived from pretty-printing a timestamp and a counter. The new nonce is the SHA2-256 of the previous bytes so that the result is guaranteed to be 32 bytes. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!16170
fix: ensure nonce used for update request is at most 32 bytes

Merge branch 'gdemay/FI-1059-fix-scrapping-logic' into 'master'

fix(cketh): bug when scraping ethereum logs

(FI-1059): Fixes an important bug related to deposit (ETH -> ckETH) when scraping Ethereum logs. In case the scraping of a range of block starting at block `h` failed (e.g., one provider returns an error), the minter would wrongly retry starting at block `h+1` (instead of `h`), therefore skipping the logs that may have occurred in block `h`. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!16112
fix(cketh): bug when scraping ethereum logs

Merge branch 'gdemay/FI-832-clean-up-TODOs' into 'master'

chore(cketh): clean-up TODOs and consolidate address validation

(FI-832): Clean-up all remaining TODOs in `rs/ethereum`. While doing so, consolidate the validation of the recipient's address during withdrawals (ckETH -> ETH) into a single function. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!16052
chore(cketh): clean-up TODOs and consolidate address validation

Merge branch 'gdemay/limit-request-nonces' into 'master'

fix(crypto): Limit size of nonces in HTTP requests

Nonces in HTTP requests are user-provided data, typically randomly generated, used to created distinct requests with otherwise identical fields (see the [IC specification](https://internetcomputer.org/docs/current/references/ic-interface-spec#authentication)). This MR ensures that the provided nonces are at most 32 bytes. Requests with larger nonces will be rejected by the IC and not processed any further. Once this MR is merged, the IC specification will be adapted accordingly to mention this new restriction. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!16066
fix(crypto): Limit size of nonces in HTTP requests

Merge branch 'gdemay/FI-832-estimate-tx-price-unit-test' into 'master'

refactor(cketh): ensure transaction price estimation does not panic

(FI-832): Transaction price estimation occurs on a timer and should not panic since in that case we would not know about it (known limitation of timers). This issue is addressed as follows:
1. `estimate_transaction_price` was refactored to no longer panic
2. Added missing unit tests for `estimate_transaction_price` 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!16048
refactor(cketh): ensure transaction price estimation does not panic

Merge branch 'gdemay/FI-1040-integreation-test-resubmission' into 'master'

test(cketh): integration tests for transaction resubmission

(FI-1040): Follow-up on [MR-15891](https://gitlab.com/dfinity-lab/public/ic/-/merge_requests/15891) to add integration tests related to resubmission of stuck transactions:
1. when the transaction fees did not increase, the same raw bytes should be re-sent;
2. when the transaction fees did increase, a new transaction reflecting the change in fee should be created, signed and sent over. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15999
test(cketh): integration tests for transaction resubmission

Merge branch 'gdemay/FI-1033-more-tests' into 'master'

test(cketh): integration tests for withdrawals

(FI-1033): Follow-up on [MR-15842](https://gitlab.com/dfinity-lab/public/ic/-/merge_requests/15842) to add more integration tests regarding withdrawals ckETH -> ETH, which includes
1. basic sanity checks when a withdrawal should be rejected (insufficient funds, ledger approval missing, withdrawn amount too low, etc)
2. some edge-cases involving multiple providers given inconsistent answers for `eth_feeHistory` or `eth_getTransactionReceipt`.

More integration tests regarding transaction resubmission is planned in another ticket (FI-1040) 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15891
test(cketh): integration tests for withdrawals

Merge branch 'gdemay/FI-1041-dashboard-improvements' into 'master'

feat(cketh): display first scraped block number and minimum withdrawal amount on dashboard

(FI-1041): Minor improvements on the ckETH minter dashboard to add the following information:
1. Display the minimum withdrawal amount.
2. Display the first scraped block number. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15958
feat(cketh): display first scraped block number and minimum withdrawal amount on dashboard

Merge branch 'gdemay/FI-911-minter-pot' into 'master'

feat(cketh): track minter's balance

(FI-911): Track the ETH managed by the ckETH minter across deposits and withdrawals. This includes the following information:
1. ETH directly managed by the ckETH minter's address, which has the following lifecycle:
    1. This amount increases upon every deposit made to the helper smart contract (ETH -> ckETH).
    2. This amount decreases upon every withdrawal ckETH -> ETH. The exact deducted amount depends on whether the transaction was successful: it is the sum of the transaction value and the effective transaction fees if the transaction was successful; or, it is only the effective transactions fees in case the transaction failed (e.g., withdrawal was made to a smart contract address resulting in an out-of-gas error). 

   It is an important invariant that this tracked amount of ETH managed by the ckETH minter never falls below zero. Note that it's expected that this tracked amount can be less or equal than the effective amount of ETH associated with the ckETH minter's address (and that is visible on Etherescan or can be retrieved by `eth_getBalance`) due to the following reasons
    * Transfer made directly to the minter's address without going through the helper smart contract are not tracked.
    * Deposits made via the helper smart contract that are invalid are not tracked, e.g. the given IC principal is invalid or the originating address is blocked.
2. Total transaction fees over all finalized transactions ckETH -> ETH: Useful to derive an average transaction fee (the number of sent transactions can be deduced from the `next_nonce` value) and also to compare it with the unspent transaction fees below.
3. Total unspent transaction fees: given that transaction fees are dynamic and not known in advance on Ethereum, the ckETH minter issues transaction by assuming that the maximal transaction fee will be deducted, which is often not the case. This means that for every finalized transaction a part of the transaction fee that was burnt on the ledger was not used and is currently owned solely by the ckETH minter. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15789
feat(cketh): track minter's balance

Merge branch 'gdemay/FIX-consolidate-deps' into 'master'

fix: consolidate dependencies in `state_machine_tests`

Follow-up on [MR-15376](https://gitlab.com/dfinity-lab/public/ic/-/merge_requests/15376) to fix some discrepancies between `rs/state_machine_tests/BUILD.bazel` and `rs/state_machine_tests/Cargo.toml`:
1. Bazel uses `rand_0_8_4` but Cargo just `0.8` (pinned to `0.8.5` in Cargo.lock)
2. Bazel uses `//rs/types/base_types` but Cargo uses `ic-test-utilities`

Merge branch 'gdemay/FI-984-memoize-hash' into 'master'

refactor(cketh): memoize transaction hash

(FI-984): The hash of an ethereum signed transaction is used to uniquely identify a transaction and is often queried to retrieve information about a concrete transaction. Computing the hash of an EIP-1559 signed transaction is somewhat computationally involved:
1. RLP encoding of all involved fields
2. Keccak-256 on the bytes resulting from the RLP encoding.

To avoid wasting computation resources, this MR memoizes the transaction hash upon instantiation of an `SignedEip1559TransactionRequest`, whose value can then be retrieved by querying the `hash()` method. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15813

Merge branch 'gdemay/FI-977-multi-providers-transaction-price' into 'master'

feat(cketh): use multiple providers to retrieve transaction fee history

(FI-977): Query multiple RPC providers for `eth_feeHistory` that is used to determined the current transaction fees. Each fee history result contains among other things the `oldestBlock` (see [Ethereum JSON-RPC specification](https://ethereum.github.io/execution-apis/api-documentation/)), which corresponds to the "lowest number block of the returned range". The results are reduced using a stable median on `oldestBlock` as follows:
1. it's expected that any 2 fee history results that have the same value for `oldestBlock` are equal.
2. The fee history result with the median `oldestBlock` value is returned.

A compromised node provider could only influence the return fee history result if the other providers return results whose `oldestBlock` differ by at least 2 blocks. In practice this is rarely the case (see for example the height of nodes on [Ethereum Mainnet RPC URL List](https://chainlist.org/)). 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15672
feat(cketh): use multiple providers to retrieve transaction fee history

Merge branch 'gdemay/FI-948-limit-withdrawal-queue-size' into 'master'

feat(cketh): Limit number of parallel operations in withdrawals ckETH -> ETH

(FI-948): Limit the number of parallel operations involved in a withdrawal ckETH -> ETH:
1. The number of pending withdrawal requests is limited to `1000`. Additional withdrawal requests will not be accepted by the minter.
2. The number of pending transaction nonces is limited to `100`. No additional pending withdrawal request will be processed by the minter.
3. At each timer interval, the pending withdrawal requests are processed as follows:
    1. At most 5 new pending withdrawal requests are pulled to create new Ethereum transactions.
    2. At most 5 transactions will be signed via threshold ECDSA.
    3. At most 5 signed transactions will be sent to Ethereum via `eth_sendRawTransaction`.
    4. The frequency of the timer will double (3min instead of 6min) as long as there is still work to do. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15576

Merge branch 'gdemay/FI-933-remove-signed-tx' into 'master'

refactor(cketh): simplify data structure for withdrawal flow [override-didc-check]

(FI-933): Simplify the data structure in `EthTransactions` that contain transactions issued by the minter for withdrawals (ckETH -> ETH) in various states. Namely the queue `signed_tx` that contained signed transactions waiting to be sent to Ethereum via `eth_sendRawTransaction` has been removed. The new behaviour is as follows
1. For resubmission: for every non-mined nonce we evaluate whether the price of the last sent transaction is still up-to-date. If it is, we dont do any state modification; otherwise, we create a new transaction with a price bump and put it in `created_tx`.
1. We create transactions by processing withdrawal requests (as is).
1. We sign transactions in `created_tx` and add them to `sent_tx` directly.
1. For every non-mined nonce, we send the last transaction in `sent_tx` implying that sending a transaction is not a state-changing operation 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15355

(FI-942): Finalize transactions issued by the minter for withdrawals as follows:
1. On a timer, query the current transaction count at finalized block height.

Merge branch 'gdemay/FI-933-resubmit-transactions' into 'master'

feat(cketh): resubmit stuck transactions

(FI-933): Resubmit transactions sent by the minter that did not make progress. On a timer query the current transaction price and latest transaction count:
1. Every sent transaction whose nonce is not smaller than the latest transaction count will be resubmitted.
2. If the price of the transaction is still up-to-date, the transaction to be resubmitted will be inserted in the `signed_tx` queue to be resent as is.
3. Otherwise, the a new transaction with a bumped price will be created and inserted in the `created_tx` queue to be signed and sent.

Resubmission was tested successfully [locally](https://sepolia.etherscan.io/address/0x8C73Cc448c834f2322e0415097C8Ec0Bfe9Db223) by initially creating transactions with an artificially low tipping fee. On the dashboard it then looks like this:

Merge branch 'gdemay/FI-867-blocking-withdrawal' into 'master'

feat(cketh-experimental): blocking withdrawal flow until transaction minted [override-didc-check]

(FI-867): Refactor the withdrawal flow with a new data structure `EthTransactions` to enforce the following invariants:
1. Withdrawal requests from the user are stored in a queue, which may contain several such requests.
2. There is at most one pending request, which is initially not set.
5. On a timer, try to confirm the pending transaction in one go:
    1. If there is no pending transaction, take a withdrawal request from the queue, estimate the current transaction fees, increment the transaction nonce and create an `Eip1559TransactionRequest` as pending transaction
    2. Signed the request with threshold ECDSA
    3. Send the signed transaction to Ethereum via `eth_sendRawTransaction`
    4. Observe whether the transaction is confirmed, meaning that it was mined in a block. If confirmed, move the pending transaction to the pool of confirmed transaction.
    5. If any of those steps fails, return
3. On the next timer pick-up, the pending transaction and go back at the step where it previously was before failing and do the next steps

This process was successfully tested [locally](https://sepolia.etherscan.io/address/0x907b6efc1a398fd88a8161b3ca02eec8eaf72ca1) (recording multiple withdrawal requests and processing Ethereum transactions one at a time).

Merge branch 'gdemay/FI-875-error-send-raw-tx' into 'master'

feat(experimental-ckETH): sanitize errors for `eth_sendRawTransaction` [override-didc-check]

(FI-875): Sending an Ethereum transaction via HTTP outcalls with the JSON-RPC method [`eth_sendRawTransaction`](https://ethereum.org/en/developers/docs/apis/json-rpc/#eth_sendrawtransaction) is problematic for the following reasons:
1. The signed transaction will be send multiple (subnet size) times to one JSON-RPC provider but `eth_sendRawTransaction` is by definition not idempotent (it changes the state of the Ethereum blockchain). This means that one subnet node may get an ok result, while the other nodes will receive an error (typically something like the transaction being `already known`). The result of the HTTP outcall after consensus will therefore be an error, even though the transaction was successfully sent to the Ethereum blockchain.
2. Errors are unfortunately not standardized in the [JSON-RPC Ethereum API](https://ethereum.org/en/developers/docs/apis/json-rpc/) and so different Ethereum clients **do** respond with different errors in that case. This implies that the result of the HTTP outcall after consensus may end up in an unexpected error or worse that no consensus was achieved if they were too many different errors.

To circumvent this, this MR sanitizes the response of HTTP outcalls for `eth_sendRawTransaction` by parsing the returned `code` and `message` in case of an error for 4 different Ethereum clients: 
1. [Geth](https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum)
2. [Nethermind](https://github.com/NethermindEth/nethermind)
3. [Erigon](https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon)
4. [Besu](https://github.com/hyperledger/besu) 

Those providers constitutes [more than 99% of Ethereum nodes](https://ethernodes.org/). 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14336
feat(experimental-ckETH): sanitize errors for `eth_sendRawTransaction` [override-didc-check]

fix(experimental-ckETH): fix computation of `signature_y_parity`

Merge branch 'gdemay/CRP-2166-signature-y-parity' into 'master'

feat(crypto): CRP-2166 recover `signature_y_parity` for ecdsa-secp256k1

Given a public key, a message digest and a signature on it, compute the parity of the y value of the curve point for which r is the x-value in the ECDSA secp256k1 signing process. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14121
feat(crypto): CRP-2166 recover `signature_y_parity` for ecdsa-secp256k1

Merge branch 'gdemay/FI-867-sign-and-send' into 'master'

feat(experimental-ckETH): timer to sign and send pending transactions [override-didc-check]

(FI-867): Follow-up on [MR-13925](https://gitlab.com/dfinity-lab/public/ic/-/merge_requests/13925) to withdraw ckETH to ETH. This MR processes queued transactions as follows:
1. on a timer, sign prepared transactions from [MR-13925](https://gitlab.com/dfinity-lab/public/ic/-/merge_requests/13925). Queue signed transactions.
2. on a timer, try to send via `eth_sendRawTransaction` to Ethereum every signed transaction. Queue sent transactions if the call was successful, otherwise retry sending the same transaction later on. There is currently no transformation associated with `eth_sendRawTransaction` to clean-up the response so it's expected that this call will most likely fail once the minter is deployed. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!13969
feat(experimental-ckETH): timer to sign and send pending transactions [override-didc-check]

Merge branch 'gdemay/FI-848-json-rpc-providers' into 'master'

feat(experimental-ckETH): Ethereum RPC client for querying multiple providers

(FI-848): Introduce an Ethereum RPC client `EthRpcClient` that is used to handle all JSON-RPC calls to Ethereum RPC node providers. Depending on whether the considered call is security relevant for ckETH, two behaviours are provided:
1. Multiple providers are queried in parallel with the same request and their results are expected to be all equal. This is to ensure that no single provider can influence the minter's state. This is the case for `eth_getLogs`, `eth_getBlockByNumber` and `eth_getTransactionByHash`.
2. Providers are queried sequentially until the first JSON-RPC response is encountered. This is to ensure that a single provider if down will not negatively impact the system's liveness. This is the case for `eth_feeHistory` and for `eth_sendRawTransaction`. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14044
feat(experimental-ckETH): Ethereum RPC client for querying multiple providers

Merge branch 'gdemay/FI-848-response-size' into 'master'

refactor(experimental-ckETH): reduce `max_response_bytes` in HTTP outcalls from 200 KB to 10KB

(FI-848): Seem impact on burn rate:
1. 2023.08.11 at 13:30 ZRH: Balance: `11_762_435_637_357` Cycles after re-installation
2. 2023.08.11 at 14:30 ZRH: Balance: `11_749_399_533_023` -> `-13_036_104_334` cycles
3. 2023.08.11 at 15:30 ZRH: Balance: `11_738_007_836_960` -> `-11_391_696_063` cycles
4. 2023.08.11 at 16:30 ZRH: Balance: `11_724_588_013_366` -> `-13_419_823_594` cycles 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14108
refactor(experimental-ckETH): reduce `max_response_bytes` in HTTP outcalls from 200 KB to 10KB

Merge branch 'gdemay/FI-867-withdraw' into 'master'

feat(experimental-ckETH): queue for pending transactions

(FI-867): Withdrawal flow to convert ckETH back to ETH. Upon a user can request to withdraw a certain amount of ckETH to a given Ethereum address this MR prepares a transaction request as follows:
1. Estimates current price of Ethereum transactions. Ensure that the requested amount is not smaller than the maximal transaction fee.
2. Increment and retrieve the current value for transaction nonce
2. Add transaction request to queue.

Currently, the interaction with the ledger (e.g. burning requested amount of ckETH) is fake and only printed on standard output. 
In a follow-up MR, a timer will work on this queue to sign a transaction request via t-ECDSA, send it to Ethereum blockchain and check its status at regular interval. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!13925
feat(experimental-ckETH): queue for pending transactions

2. Provides a new query point "dump_state_for_debugging" to retrieve the current state of the minter canister for debugging purposes. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!13947
refactor(experimental-ckETH): reduce number of HTTP outcalls to scrap ETH log events

Merge branch 'gdemay/FI-865-transaction-status' into 'master'

feat(experimental-ckETH): check status of Ethereum transactions

(FI-865) Check the status of an Ethereum transaction from its hash by calling [`eth_getTransactionByHash`](https://ethereum.github.io/execution-apis/api-documentation/). This method was favoured over `eth_getTransactionReceipt` since the first does return some information in case the transaction is pending and not yet finalized. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!13887
feat(experimental-ckETH): check status of Ethereum transactions

2. anonymous principal

Merge branch 'dsd/pocket_ic/log_improvements' into 'master'

fix(VER-2529): Logging Improvements

This removes all command line flags for PocketIC regarding logging. As we need to take care of environment variables anyway, let's use them. Adding command line arguments just introduces potential for confusions (precedence?)

* PocketIC will use `RUST_LOG` env var by default to set log levels of all crates.
* `POCKET_IC_LOG_DIR` allows specifying a directory that contains log files.
* Using `POCKET_IC_LOG_DIR_LEVELS`, one can control the log levels for the log files independent of `RUST_LOG`.

So, e.g., providing the following settings, PocketIC will log use the level WARN when logging to stdout (while ignoring all other logs), but level TRACE when logging to files in the directory /tmp/pocket_ic/log:

`RUST_LOG="pocket_ic_server=WARN" POCKET_IC_LOG_DIR="/tmp/pocket_ic/log" POCKET_IC_LOG_DIR_LEVELS="pocket_ic_server=TRACE,tower_http=TRACE,axum::reject=TRACE"` 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15165

feat(VER-2482): remove stale states from the state machine

This MR contains two changes:
* In `StateMachine::execute_payload` we delete all but the newest state after processing a batch.
* Introduce a method `StateManagerImpl::latest_state_hash` that returns the latest state hash, irrespective of whether that state has been certified.

Rationale: Not removing the states causes memory issues for long-running StateMachines. For canister tests, we only ever care about the latest state. The method `latest_state_hash` comes in handy when you want to identify the state after each batch without paying the price of certification.

Merge branch 'andrew/update-reproducibility-check' into 'master'

feat(NODE-898): Extend repro-check.sh to check build reproducibility of hostOS and setupOS

Repro-check.sh is currently designed to check the build reproducibility of the guestOS update image. This MR extends the script to also check the build reproducibility of the hostOS update image and the setupOS disk image.

Note that when an `Elect Replica Version` proposal id is given to the script, it also checks whether the proposal hash (the hash for the image listed in the proposal payload) matches the hash of the image downloaded from the CDN/the locally built image. The replica proposal payloads do not currently contain the hash for HostOS update and setupOS disk images, so the script only currently checks this for guestOS.

The script will fail if given a proposal id of an `Elect HostOS version` proposal. However, in releases, we direct people to verify reproducibility using git commits, and HostOS version proposals will only be every few months, so I don't believe this will be an issue. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15798

Merge branch 'basvandijk/require-args-for-CMCM-in-prepare-nns-upgrade-proposal-text' into 'master'

chore: prepare-nns-upgrade-proposal-text.sh: throw error in case no upgrade args are provided for CMC

This lets `prepare-nns-upgrade-proposal-text.sh` throw an error in case the user forgets to specify the required upgrade arguments for the cycles-minting canister. For example:

```
$ testnet/tools/nns-tools/prepare-nns-upgrade-proposal-text.sh cycles-minting cd63057550f46b939de511beef7f39bb598408d1
cycles-minting requires upgrade arguments. We recommend setting them to '()', i.e.:
testnet/tools/nns-tools/prepare-nns-upgrade-proposal-text.sh cycles-minting cd63057550f46b939de511beef7f39bb598408d1 '()'
``` 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!16212

Merge branch 'basvandijk/replace-ic-recovery-lib-with-bin' into 'master'

chore: ic_mainnet_nns_recovery: replace the ic-recovery lib with its binary

This switches the `ic_mainnet_nns_recovery` system-test from using `ic-recovery` as a library to using it as a binary. The reason is that we need to use the mainnet version of `ic-recovery` and `ic-replay` such that we won't run into incompatibility issues when using a mainnet `ic.json5` config file with a HEAD version of `ic-replay`.

We don't yet use the mainnet version of `ic-recovery` since we first need to wait until our changes to ic-recovery (which are part of this MR) are released. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15793

Merge branch 'basvandijk/replace-ic-replay-lib-with-mainnet-bin' into 'master'

fix: replace the ic-replay library with the mainnet binary

`ic_mainnet_nns_recovery` was using ic-replay as a library. This had the problem that when a commit got merged in master that changed the format of the `ic.json5` config file with respect to mainnet, ic-replay would fail because it expected the new format while it was using the mainnet config file.

To prevent this we now use the mainnet ic-replay binary instead of the HEAD version of the ic-replay library.

This doesn't completely fix the `ic.json5` config file issue because we still use `ic-recovery` as a library which uses the `ic-replay` library internally. So that will follow later. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15470
fix: replace the ic-replay library with the mainnet binary

Merge branch 'basvandijk/colocated-ic-mainnet-nns-recovery' into 'master'

feat: support colocating the ic-mainnet-nns-recovery

This extends the colocated test-driver with the following features that enable running the ic-mainnet-nns-recovery test in a colocated matter:

* Support optionally forwarding the SSH agent to the colocated test-driver VM and then to the docker container running the system-test. This allows the colocated system-test to SSH using the user's identity into the backpod pod `zh1-pyr07`.

* Support optionally adding an IPv4 address for the colocated test-driver VM. This is needed for the VM to reach the backup pod `zh1-pyr07` which only has an IPv4 address.

Unfortunately we can't (yet) use the colocated `ic-mainnet-nns-recovery` interactively since the command `source ".../setup/set_testnet_env_variables.sh"`, logged by the system-test which should be run by the user in his terminal, can only work in the docker container on the co-located test-driver and not in the user's local terminal.

However this support would still be good to have once we run this in CI. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15481
feat: support colocating the ic-mainnet-nns-recovery

Merge branch 'basvandijk/let-p8s-scrape-recovered-nns' into 'master'

chore: let p8s scrape recovered nns

This adapts the `ic_mainnet_nns_recovery` library such that it configures prometheus to scrape the topology of the recovered NNS subnet instead of the initial topology.

The resources of the p8s VM have also been bumped because it now has to scrape the whole mainnet topology (since we use the topology of the recovered mainnet registry) which requires more resources than the default. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15427
chore: let p8s scrape recovered nns

Merge branch 'basvandijk/fixes-to-sns-scripts' into 'master'

chore: fix SNS upgrade scripts to work with the ic_mainnet_nns_recovery system-test

This adapts the scripts under `testnet/tools/nns-tools` to work on testnets created by the `recovered_mainnet_nns` system-test.

* It configures `dfx` to use the `DFX_HOME` environment variable as its home directory.

* It uses the `PEM` environment variable to specify the PEM file instead of hard coding it to `$NNS_TOOLS_DIR/test_user.pem`.

* It makes sure the node in the application subnet (to which we deploy SNSes) is correctly initialised.

* It sets the `NNS_URL` to the Boundary Node and it makes sure the Boundary Node actually becomes healthy. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15261
chore: fix SNS upgrade scripts to work with the ic_mainnet_nns_recovery system-test

Merge branch 'basvandijk/add-app-subnet-to-nns-upgrade-test' into 'master'

feat: support testing SNS upgrades on mainnet state

This extends the `ic_mainnet_nns_recovery::setup()` function to make the testnet, with the recovered mainnet NNS subnet state, suitable for deploying SNSes to. Specifically it:

* Adds a new application subnet.
* Creates a cycle wallet.
* Configures SNS-W to:
  * deploy SNS to the newly created application subnet.
  * Allows the created cycle wallet to create SNSes.
* Extends the `set_testnet_env_variables.sh` file to also set the `SUBNET_URL`, `WALLET_CANISTER`, `SNS_QUILL` and `IDL2JSON` environment variables which are required by the SNS shell scripts. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14778
feat: support testing SNS upgrades on mainnet state

Merge branch 'basvandijk/unstuck_subnet_test-curl-fail' into 'master'

chore: let curl fail in the unstuck_subnet_test in case it hits an error

We had some test failures due to curl not being able to download the image.
However in those cases curl didn't actually fail but the script failed later.
It would be more understandable if curl itself fails if it can't download the image.
So we pass the [`--fail`](https://curl.se/docs/manpage.html#-f) flag. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15185
chore: let curl fail in the unstuck_subnet_test in case it hits an error

Merge branch 'basvandijk/temporarily-disable-nns_upgrade_test' into 'master'

fix: temporarily disable the nns_upgrade_test

The problem is that commit 3ba9857f19cf22b5da85e1268f914f58f66f3d3a
introduced a change in the format of ic.json5 which means that
the ic.json5 we download from a mainnet node has an older format
than the one expected by ic-replay.

Ways forward:

* Short term: disable this test such that we can get a green RC.
  Implemented in this MR.

* Mid term: move the test to a different pipeline separate
  from the nightly RC pipeline. Something specific for the NNS.
  Such that, in case of failures, this test doesn't block IC releases
  but just blocks NNS releases.

* Long term: instead of using the HEAD version of the ic-replay
  library and binary use the mainnet version to ensure it's
  compatible with the mainnet IC. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14923

Merge branch 'basvandijk/nns_upgrade_system_test' into 'master'

Port nns_state_deployment.sh to the nns_upgrade_test system-test

`//rs/tests/nns:nns_upgrade_test` is a port of `/testnet/tools/nns_state_deployment.sh` to a manual system-test that deploys an IC with a NNS that is recovered from the latest mainnet state.

To run the test you need to be authorised to SSH into `zh1-pyr07.zh1.dfinity.network` which contains the NNS backups.

Run the test using:

```
rm -rf test_tmpdir; ict test nns_upgrade_test -- --test_env=SSH_AUTH_SOCK --test_tmpdir=test_tmpdir --flaky_test_attempts=1
```

It will take between 10 to 20 minutes to setup the recovered NNS.

Closes: NNS1-2511, NNS1-2323, NNS1-2470, NNS1-2441, NNS1-2372, NNS1-2473 

Closes NNS1-2511

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!13356

Merge branch 'or/BOUN-216' into 'master'

feat(BOUN-742): The API BN is represented in the registry

Adds the following NNS record type:
```protobuf
message ApiBoundaryNodeRecord {
  string version = 1;
  string domain = 2;
}
```

The keys for `ApiBoundaryNodeRecord` will have the format: `api_boundary_node_<node_id>`.  
This indicates that a replica with `<node_id>` is required to act as an API Boundary Node.

Adds 4 new proposal types:
* `AddApiBoundaryNode`
* `UpdateApiBoundaryNodesVersion`
* `UpdateApiBoundaryNodeDomain`
* `RemoveApiBoundaryNodes`

## Open questions for the NNS team

* Updating get-topology

Merge branch 'or-simplify-3' into 'master'

chore: start breaking up ErrorCause into specific error types

This is a simple pass on breaking up ErrorCause into the following:

1. ApiError
2. ProxyError (will be done in a follow-up)
3. LookupError (will be done in a follow-up)

My suggestion here is that, on failure, API endpoints always return an `Err(ApiError)`, which implements `IntoResponse`.

Separately (but will be done later), the `Proxy` trait will return `ProxyError` and `Lookup` will return `LookupError`.
These will then be automatically converted to `ApiError` using `thiserror`. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14364
chore: start breaking up ErrorCause into specific error types

Merge branch 'maksym/follow-1160-k-data' into 'master'

fix: add instructions-per-byte factor to data sending api calls

This MR adds instructions-per-byte conversion factor for charging instructions in data sending api calls to account for sandbox-replica communication.

Specifically:
- `msg_reply_data_append`
- `msg_reject`
- `call_data_append`

When charging instructions for a payload size it's important to account not only for the memory, but also for the time that is spent for transferring the payload from canister's wasm through sandbox into replica. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15315

Merge branch 'maksym/follow-1160-k' into 'master'

fix: add instructions-per-byte factor for proper payload counting

This MR adds instructions-per-byte conversion factor for charging instructions to account for sandbox-replica communication.

When charging instructions for a payload size it's important to account not only for the memory, but also for the time that is spent for transferring the payload from canister's wasm through sandbox into replica.

It also required to adjust the instruction counter in wasm instrumentation. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14985
fix: add instructions-per-byte factor for proper payload counting

Merge branch 'maksym/follow-1160-bounded-vec-item-size' into 'master'

chore: add limit to a single HTTP header in headers to comply with the spec

This MR applies a limit to a single HTTP header size to comply with the interface spec for `http_request`.

This is implemented via adding a new template parameter `MAX_ALLOWED_ELEMENT_DATA_SIZE` to `BoundaryVec`.
Since `BoundaryVec` is getting bigger it was moved to a separate file.

Spec: https://internetcomputer.org/docs/current/references/ic-interface-spec/#ic-http_request 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14926
chore: add limit to a single HTTP header in headers to comply with the spec

Merge branch 'maksym/follow-1160-header-size' into 'master'

chore: implement HTTP headers size limit for HTTP outcall requests

This MR adds a size limit to HTTP headers in HTTP outcall requests to comply with the spec.

To implement size limitation added a new parameter to an existing structure `BoundedVec`, so that it can be bounded either by length or by the size. This required adding a `DataSize` trait to calculate the underlying data size of each vector element.

Spec: https://internetcomputer.org/docs/current/references/ic-interface-spec/#ic-http_request 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14824
chore: implement HTTP headers size limit for HTTP outcall requests

Merge branch 'NNS1-2636-p3' into 'master'

feat(NNS1-2636): Matched Funding / Add idempotent method for creating SNS Neuron Recipes

This MR prepares `create_sns_neuron_recipes` to be moved to swap finalization, while still maintaining the current flow to reduce complexity of review. To move this stage to finalization, the method must 
1. Not panic and cause a lock to not be dropped
2. Must be idempotent

To accomplish these tasks I've refactored the method to not panic when state is missing. the best way to indicate success/failure of this is to return a SweepResult (which will also eventually be used in swap finalization response). I've also added additional optional state that will be set to maintain idempotency. This is the field `has_created_neuron_recipes` on CfNeuorns and BuyerState.


Closes NNS1-2636

Merge branch 'NNS1-2361' into 'master'

fix(sns): Apply SNS maturity modulation at the end of the 7 day window

In this MR I applied maturity modulation at the end of the time window instead of at the beginning. To accomplish this I had to do a few things:

1. Introduce a test that failed given the current bad behavior. This needed an updates to the fixtures framework in `fixtures/mod.rs`
2. Actually apply modulation in the `maybe_finalize_disburse_maturity`. This required moving some method invocations into this function.
3. Since we have a check to make sure the amount of maturity being disbursed is greater than the SNS's transaction fee, add a new conditional check that will not allow a disburse operation to be performed if the worst case modulation will bring the amount below a transaction fee. This required me to move some constants from the CMC into `nervous_system/common/~/cms.rs`

Closes NNS1-2361

Merge branch 'NNS1-2475' into 'master'

[NNS1-2475] Include CreateServiceNervousSystem proposals in the SNS proposal lock

The actual source code changes are very trivial and can be found in `rs/nns/governance/src/governance.rs`, everything else is test code related. I've expanded on the NNS governance fixtures and interleaving test framework. Most of the code change was including a new `EnvironmentFixture` and `InterleavingTestEnvironment`. The `InterleavingTestEnvironment` is the most interesting: it uses `mspc` channels to send control messages back and forth between threads. This allows the tests to determine when the cross-canister call should be made.

Note: There is no interleaving test that guarantees the CSNS proposal blocks other OSTS and CSNS proposals because the CSNS does not make an async call. However, I've forced it to `acquire` the lock so that OSTS will block other CSNS proposals.

[NNS1-2447] Support passing the token_logo to the SNS icrc1 ledger

While testing with the nns-dapp it was discovered that the token-logo was not supported in the sns-cli and subsequently not passed to the icrc1 ledger init args.

In this MR I've added a new field to the init-config-file under the `token` group, and made sure this was passed to the SNS-W properly. Additionally, the SnsInitPayload will add the logo to the icrc1 metadata fields as outlined in this spec https://github.com/dfinity/ICRC-1/blob/main/standards/ICRC-1/README.md#standard-metadata-entries

Closes NNS1-2447 

Closes NNS1-2447

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!13907
[NNS1-2447] Support passing the token_logo to the SNS icrc1 ledger

Merge branch '@anchpop/NNS1-2459' into 'master'

NNS1-2459: Make sure restricted_countries is opitonal in sns-cli

Closes NNS1-2459 

Closes NNS1-2459

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!13931

Merge branch 'NNS1-2448' into 'master'

[NNS1-2448] Support settling the Neurons' fund for 1-proposal

System testing of the 1-proposal feature uncovered that the settling of the neurons' fund was not completely implemented. In this MR, I add the ability for settle_community_fund_participation to support the 1-proposal flow. This required a few changes:

1. A change of authorization method. Since the SNS is now created after the 1-prop is executed, the swap_canister_id is not part of the proposal data. Instead, query the SNS-W canister for all deployed SNSes and see if the caller is a swap_canister.
2. Make sure refunding of maturity is supported for all error cases. This was not implemented before.
3. Set the `sns_token_swap_lifecycle` field in the CSNS proposal_data field as it transitions through its state. This is what supports idempotency for settling of the Neurons' fund.
4. Tests on tests

Closes NNS1-2448 

Closes NNS1-2448

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!13898
[NNS1-2448] Support settling the Neurons' fund for 1-proposal

[NODE-1188] Nested HostOS Upgrade Test

```
bazel run --config=systest //rs/tests/nested:upgrade
```

Creates a new HostOS upgrade test that runs on nested VMs.
1. Use SetupOS to install a node and join it to a testnet.
1. Join the new node to a subnet and check replica health.
1. Use proposals to elect a new HostOS version and trigger an upgrade on the node.
1. Check that the node upgrades successfully, and that the replica is still healthy.

Merge branch 'eero/hostos-vsock-cid' into 'master'

HostOS VSOCK fixes

I ran into this with nested testing.

I'm pretty sure `VMADDR_CID_HOST` will always points at _this_ VM's host. This has been fine because when we are the outermost host, it will point to itself. As soon as we start to nest VMs, it will point up one level, resulting in an error.

The HostOS should not care what CID it gets, all that matters is the GuestOS can reference it (which it can find through its own `VMADDR_CID_HOST`). This is also how the old VSOCK code was operating - but we still need to test.

Merge branch 'eero/key-linking' into 'master'

Resolve symlinks when copying SSH keys

This can lead to a weird issue when testing upgrades.

We've been linking all three `admin`, `backup`, and `readonly` keys in testing, and they remain this way when they are pulled into the node.

On the first launch, `admin` is the only key with real contents. It is copied into place directly, and SSH access works.
Then, the SSH key manager will empty out the `backup` and `readonly` keys. These are both links to the same `admin` file, so any keys here are cleared.

After an upgrade, the node will reconfigure itself with the now empty `admin` key, and SSH access is lost. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14703

commits.message:
Merge branch 'always-generate-reward-events-daniel-wong' into 'master'

fix(sns-governance): NNS1-2588, NNS1-2635. Sane-ify rewards in SNS by bringing it more in line with NNS.

More concretely,

1. RewardEvents are generated every round, even if the (initial and final) reward rate is 0, and even if there are no proposals. This has a minor externally visible effect: latest_reward_round keeps advancing. This requires changes to ensure that roll over keeps happening. To do this, we copy some code from NNS (this is good for our eventual goal of deduplicating NNS and SNS code). Specifically, the RewardEvent.total_available_e8s_equivalent field is copied, along with related method RewardEvent::e8s_equivalent_to_be_rolled_over.

2. Stop using horribly hacky is_eligible_for_rewards field. Thus, the VotingRewardsParameters::rewards_enabled method has been deleted. This brings us within one step of deleting that field entirely.

3. Data migration (in post_upgrade) targeting only SNSs that have final and initial reward rate set to 0. AFAIK, only Dragginz has 0 (final and initial) reward rate.

# Data Migration

Always generating RewardEvents (regardless of reward rate) is a problem for proposals that are stuck in the ReadyToSettle state. As far as I know, there is only one such proposal: Dragginz proposal 36. What this MR does is effectively sets those proposal(s) to Settled, by populating the reward_event_end_timestamp_seconds field.

Why are there proposals stuck in ReadyToSettle:

  1. When they were made, proposals were enabled. This results in is_eligible_for_rewards to be set to true.
  2. Before distribute_rewards had a chance to process them, distribute_rewards was effectively disabled by setting initial and final reward rate to 0.

This explains why there is only one known case of this: there is only a short window in which making proposals would cause them to end up in that state, and most SNSs have always had non-zero reward rate.

To support later deletion of is_eligible_for_rewards, we need to make sure that existing proposals where is_eligible_for_rewards = false would remain in the Settled state. This is achieved using the same method as "stuck in ReadyToSettle": set the reward_event_end_timestamp_seconds field in the proposal.

In both of these cases (i.e. stuck in ReadyToSettle and is_eligible_for_rewards = false), ballots have not been cleared. This data migration does that.

Let me reiterate, these data migrations only target SNSs that have final and initial reward rate set to 0. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!16148
fix(sns-governance): NNS1-2588, NNS1-2635. Sane-ify rewards in SNS by bringing it more in line with NNS.

Merge branch 'reward-status-detection-fix-daniel-wong' into 'master'

fix(sns-governance): NNS1-2588: Fixed a bug in reward_status.

The problem is that the old field (`reward_event_round`) was not used to detect whether a proposal has been rewarded, only the new field (`reward_event_end_timestamp_seconds`).

This solves that by introducing a new method: `has_been_rewarded`, which correctly uses both. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!16028
fix(sns-governance): NNS1-2588: Fixed a bug in reward_status.

Merge branch 'publish-canister-proposal-types-daniel-wong' into 'master'

feat(nns-root): NNS1-2690: Exposed various *_nns_canister methods of NNS root.

We were already serving such requests, but now they are part of our documented interface. They were previously not documented, probably to avoid clutter, since only governance is allowed to call them.

The goal of this was for the associated types to be in our automatically generated NNS root.did file (and this has been achieved). This lets clients interpret (and make) NNS proposals that use these types via serialized payload field.

Also, deleted obsolete authz stuff.

Also, renamed corresponding *CanisterProposal types to *CanisterRequest, because "Proposal" is not apt. This rename resulted in a fair amount of fallout, which explains why there are an unusual number of files in this MR. Fortunately, most of the affected files contain a small amount of very mechanical changes.

Closes NNS1-2690. 

Closes NNS1-2690

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15964
feat(nns-root): NNS1-2690: Exposed various *_nns_canister methods of NNS root.

test: NNS1-2676: Test that runs copying of inactive neurons to stable memory during heartbeat, and verifies the copy.

This new test takes about 20 minutes to run (on my devenv VM) -> it has "manual" tag.

The test initializes StateMachine using data from zh1-pyr07, a new technique that we recently got working. This takes a few minutes. We may want to do more of these kinds of tests in the future. In that case, we'll want to move some of the test initialization code to a common library.

The test uses the special `feature = "test"` build of NNS governance canister WASM. This is so that copying of inactive neurons is enabled, i.e. happens in heartbeat.

This also adds some (Prometheus) metric(s) that show the progress of the copy.

This also adds a bunch of helpers to test_utils/.../state_test_helpers.rs. E.g.

  * create_super_powerful_neuron
  * mint_icp
  * scrape_metrics
  * etc.

They seem pretty nice, if I do say so myself. These additions could fairly easily be broken out into its own MR though, if we wanted to make this MR smaller.

This temporarily disregards duplicate followee during validation. This will be removed later as part of http://go/jira/NNS1-2622, which we will need to work on soon.

I found that it takes about 1 s to process a batch of 1_000 heap neurons (again, on my devenv VM). Heartbeat starts failing when a batch size of 10_000 neurons is used -> 1_000 seems like a good number. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14876

Merge branch 'write-inactive-neurons-through-to-stable-memory-daniel-wong' into 'master'

feat: NNS1-2530: Write inactive neurons through to stable memory when they are modified.

Also, moved Governance::neuron_can_be_archived to Neuron::is_inactive. A bonus of this is that we now have consistent terminology: no "archivable" just "inactive".

# Mocking

An innovation (for us) in testing: I started using the `mockall` library. The first example in [their docs] is enough to get started, but let me give the TL;DR:

[their docs]: https://docs.rs/mockall/latest/mockall/

It supplies an attribute that you slap onto any trait. E.g. suppose you have `trait T`. The attribute generates `MockT`, a concrete type that implements `T`. In turn, `MockT` lets you specify what method calls you expect.

FWIW, `mockall` is already being used in many places within the `ic` repo.

# Gating

This feature is NOT built by default. This is controlled by using the following pattern:

```rust
if cfg! {any(test, feature = "test")} {
    new_code();
}
```

# WASM size

This causes NNS governance WASM to grow a little bit. This lead to the need to increase the size limit.

It is surprising that the WASM grew past the old limit. I suspect that this growth is mainly caused by the introduction of `mockall`. OTOH, that would be surprising, because the optimizer should be able to recognize that all the code generated by `mockall` is dead, and can therefore be stripped. :shrug: 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14759

feat: NNS1-2527: Copy batch of inactive Neurons to StableNeuronStore.

Unfortunately, it is not enough to have the Neuron itself in order to determine whether it is active or not. You must also know locks and open proposals.

As a result, we have chosen for the batch to be constructed by the caller (Governance), since it has the needed supporting auxiliary data. Of course, to do this, Governance will need the help of NeuronStore to scan a range of heap neurons based on a start point, and limit (i.e. batch size).

We would like for NeuronStore to own StableNeuronStore, but this is thwarted by the fact that StableBTreeMap is not Send (although, it might be easy to add this). There may be a way around this, but after much gnashing of teeth, I was not able to find a workaround.

Since NS cannot own StableNS, it must instead use STABLE_NEURON_STORE global. From a testing point of view, this is not so great, but as long as 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14511

Merge branch 'daniel-wong/support-collections-update-delete-upsert-stable-neurons-store' into 'master'

feat: NNS1-2503, NNS1-2504: Added collections support to update, delete, and upsert methods in StableNeuronStore.

I changed the schema a little to be more homogenous. This lead to lots of simplification. Specificaly,

```
repeated Foo foos = n;
```

now maps to

```
StableBTreeMap<(/* Neuron ID */ u64, /* index */ u64), Foo, Memory>
```

This ensures that order is preserved. That property is more important to recent_ballots, but it's also good for hot_keys, even though we don't care about order there because then we can reconstitute Neuron exactly. This will make verification of copying from heap to stable memory easier in the future.

OTOH, this homogenized schema is not so good at answering "Is P a hotkey of N?", because now, a range scan is required instead of a point look up -> maybe this schema change is not such a great idea after all?

Closes NNS1-2503.
Closes NNS1-2504. 

Closes NNS1-2503 and NNS1-2504

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14230

Merge branch 'NNS1-2528' into 'master'

NNS1-2528: Preserve the order of elements in the followees field from StableMemory read

Preserve the order of elements in the followees field. This makes it easier to see that a Neuron has been correctly copied to stable memory, because it lets us use == to compare neurons in heap vs. stable memory, rather than some custom equivalence method. 

This is done simply by storing the index/position of the element in stable memory. This would not be a backwards compatible change, but since we have no data in stable memory, this is fine.

Merge branch 'mraszyk/pocket-ic-cycle-scaling' into 'master'

feat: add cycle scaling to PocketIC

This MR enables cycle scaling in PocketIC so that, e.g., cycles consumed by canisters on fiduciary subnets are proportionally more expensive compared to a regular application subnet. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!16267
feat: add cycle scaling to PocketIC

Merge branch 'mraszyk/out-of-cycles-error' into 'master'

fix: do not print canister cycle balance in out of cycles error messages

This MR removes the canister cycle balance and freezing threshold from `CanisterOutOfCyclesError`.

The canister cycle balance and freezing threshold are supposed to be private (e.g., calling `canister_status` is only permitted to the canister's controllers and the canister itself), but error messages leak the canister cycle balance and freezing threshold. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!16235
fix: do not print canister cycle balance in out of cycles error messages

Merge branch 'mraszyk/sync-ic-did' into 'master'

chore: sync ic.did file with interface-spec repository

This MR syncs the management canister interface Candid file with the dfinity/interface-spec repository containing the authoritative specification.

The main change to existing specification compliance tests is the type of the `upgrade` variant for canister installation mode which changed from `null` to `opt record { skip_pre_upgrade : opt bool; }` and thus we use `none` (a.k.a. `Nothing` in Haskell) instead of `null`  for backwards-compatibility.

New specification compliance tests to cover new management canister API are not added in this MR. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!16032
chore: sync ic.did file with interface-spec repository

Merge branch 'mraszyk/universal-canister-api' into 'master'

feat: extend universal canister API to facilitate testing inter-canister calls with large arguments

This MR facilitates testing inter-canister calls with large arguments using the universal canister. In more detail:
- this MR adds new operations to the universal canister WASM pushing a large blob of a given length on the canister's stack and computing the length of a blob on the canister's stack (to validate the large argument in the inter-canister calls from the tests);
- this MR redefines the semantics of the `other_side` field in `CallArgs` in the universal canister API to contain operations for the caller to produce the argument to be executed by the callee (instead of storing the argument to be executed by the callee in the field directly);
- this MR adds a new function to the universal canister library that computes (succinct) operations for the caller to produce a (large) argument to be executed by the callee (and thus facilitating tests exercising inter-canister call size limits). 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!16008
feat: extend universal canister API to facilitate testing inter-canister calls with large arguments

Merge branch 'mraszyk/inspect-message-instruction-limit' into 'master'

feat: update inspect_message instruction limit

This MR updates the `inspect_message` instruction limit to 200M instructions. The motivation for this change is that `inspect_message` calls are supposed to _quickly_ sanitize the incoming ingress message to decide if the canister wants to accept it. Any expensive computation should then happen in the actual update call resulting from an accepted ingress message. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15978
feat: update inspect_message instruction limit

Merge branch 'mraszyk/k8s-execution-metrics-ids' into 'master'

fix: make inspect_message execution dashboard ids unique

This MR fixes links for inspect_message execution dashboards by making their ids unique. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15975
fix: make inspect_message execution dashboard ids unique

Merge branch 'mraszyk/farm-execution-dashboards' into 'master'

chore: sync execution dashboards with k8s repository

This MR syncs execution dashboards in Farm-based system tests/testnets with the dfinity/k8s repository sourcing the mainnet dashboards. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15906
chore: sync execution dashboards with k8s repository

Merge branch 'mraszyk/multi-subnet-state-machine-playground' into 'master'

feat: Support for multi-subnet testing using multiple StateMachines

This MR enables multi-subnet testing using multiple `StateMachine`s - one `StateMachine` per subnet. In more detail, the following changes are made:
- extending the mocked registry for `StateMachine` with multiple subnets
- instantiating `IngressFilter`, `IngressManager`, `XNetPayloadBuilderImpl`, and `PayloadBuilderImpl` in `StateMachine`
- adding new function `execute_round` to `StateMachine` to execute a round on a subnet represented by a given `StateMachine` with a payload assembled with mainnet-like limits and consisting of ingress messages and xnet messages pulled from all subnets
- adding new function `submit_ingress_as` to `StateMachine` to submit an ingress message for asynchronous execution in rounds triggered by calling `execute_round`
- adding new function `build_with_subnets` to `StateMachineBuilder` to build a `StateMachine` for multi-subnet testing
- adding an integration test demonstrating multi-subnet testing with two universal canisters deployed to two different subnets and calling each other 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15376
feat: Support for multi-subnet testing using multiple StateMachines

Merge branch 'mraszyk/deterministic-xnet-payload-builder' into 'master'

chore: enable seeded PRNG in XNetPayloadBuilderImpl

This MR enables a seeded PRNG in `XNetPayloadBuilderImpl` in addition to the default `thread_rng` so that the functions in `XNetPayloadBuilderImpl` can be made deterministic for the sake of pocketIC (pool refill task is still non-deterministic but a mock implementation will be used in pocketIC). 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15780
chore: enable seeded PRNG in XNetPayloadBuilderImpl

Merge branch 'mraszyk/slice-pool-trait' into 'master'

chore: introduce trait XNetSlicePool

This MR introduces a new trait `XNetSlicePool` and moves the field `slice_pool` from `XNetPayloadBuilderImpl` into this new trait.

As part of the pocketIC [feature](https://dfinity.atlassian.net/browse/IC-1538), the T&V team is working on local multi-subnet canister testing using one `StateMachine` per subnet and we'd like to reuse `XNetPayloadBuilderImpl` to conveniently assemble the xnet payloads for the individual `StateMachine`s.

However, we can't really use the pinned implementation of `slice_pool` as we don't really want to fetch the remote streams over HTTP when testing locally. So this MR abstracts away the field `slice_pool` from `XNetPayloadBuilderImpl` into a new trait `XNetSlicePool` and provides an implementation `XNetSlicePoolImpl` matching the current implementation of `XNetPayloadBuilderImpl`.

In a follow-up MR, we'd provide a new implementation of the trait `XNetSlicePool`. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15527
chore: introduce trait XNetSlicePool

Merge branch 'mraszyk/revert-hiding-root-key-in-status' into 'master'

Revert "fix: hide root key in status HTTP endpoint"

This MR reverts [MR](https://gitlab.com/dfinity-lab/public/ic/-/merge_requests/15356) that touched the function `common::get_root_threshold_public_key` that is used at two places (missing on one of the two occurrences):

* when serving the /api/v2/status endpoint (there the change from the rolled-back MR makes sense)
* when fetching the subnet delegation from the NNS subnet (there the change from the rolled-back MR breaks the flow) 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15596
Revert "fix: hide root key in status HTTP endpoint"

Merge branch 'mraszyk/consensus-time-trait' into 'master'

chore: introduce trait ConsensusTime

This MR introduces a new trait `ConsensusTime` and moves the function `fn consensus_time` from the trait `ConsensusPoolCache` into this new trait. This way, we minimize the interface between `ConsensusPoolCache` and `IngressManager` to that single function `consensus_time` required by `IngressManager`. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15516

Merge branch 'mraszyk/delay-update-settings-ingress-cost' into 'master'

fix: update conditions on delaying ingress induction cost for update_settings

This MR restricts the size of update_settings payloads for which the ingress induction cost charge is delayed. This is because the delay was introduced to allow changing settings of frozen canisters and small payloads are sufficient for this use case. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15484
fix: update conditions on delaying ingress induction cost for update_settings

Merge branch 'mraszyk/charge-ingress-cost-for-stopped-canisters' into 'master'

fix: ingress induction cost for not running canisters should be charged in message scheduling code

This MR places the check if the receiver of an ingress message is Running after charging the ingress induction cost because the ingress induction cost should particularly cover that the ingress message was processed by consensus and this is independent of whether the canister is Running or not.

In practice, the HTTP handler and every block validator would reject messages to canisters that are not Running, but due to race conditions it is still possible that an ingress message to a canister that is not Running makes it into a block. In that case, this message should be appropriately charged for and this is what this MR ensures. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15483
chore: introduce trait ConsensusTime
fix: ingress induction cost for not running canisters should be charged in message scheduling code

Merge branch 'mraszyk/validate-ingress-to-not-running-canisters' into 'master'

fix: IngressManager::validate_ingress checks if target canister is running

This MR adds a check that a canister receiving an ingress message is Running before the ingress message is successfully validated. This is because update calls to Stopping/Stopped canisters are rejected anyway and thus it doesn't make sense to accept such an ingress message.

In practice, the HTTP handler of the replica receiving the ingress message would reject such an ingress message with a user-friendly error message and thus the ingress message won't even make it to the unvalidated artifact pool. Hence, this MR will only be effective in the following two cases:
- a malicious node does not perform all HTTP handler checks; or
- the condition from this MR is evaluated on a different state height than the condition in the HTTP handler.

In both cases, the ingress message won't appear in the ingress history and the user client will time out polling for the ingress message.

Interface Specification MR: https://github.com/dfinity/interface-spec/pull/233

Note on an NNS integration test change: the test checks that a canister is `Stopped` by sending an ingress message to the unvalidated artifact pool of the replica (bypassing the HTTP handler). However, the ingress message can never be moved to the validated artifact pool and inducted since it doesn't pass validation (which now also checks that the canister is `Running`). Consequently, the ingress message never appears in the ingress history and polling for it times out. This MR fixes the failing test by making a `canister_status` call and asserting that the canister is indeed `Stopped`. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15335
fix: IngressManager::validate_ingress checks if target canister is running

Merge branch 'mraszyk/synchronous-ingress-filter' into 'master'

chore: introduce IngressFilter trait

This MR introduces an `IngressFilter` trait implementing the ingress filter functionality with `Send + Sync`.

The existing `IngressFilterService` can't be used in objects that need to implement `Send + Sync` and thus this MR provides a synchronous alternative. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15413
chore: introduce IngressFilter trait

Merge branch 'mraszyk/bump-large-testnet-resources' into 'master'

chore: bump large testnet resources

This MR updates increases the available disk space on the deployed IC nodes in the large testnet. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15396
chore: bump large testnet resources

Merge branch 'mraszyk/hide-root-key-in-status' into 'master'

fix: hide root key in status HTTP endpoint

It is insecure to fetch the NNS public key from a single replica's HTTP handler and thus this flow should only be used in tests against development IC instances. Hence, this MR hides the NNS public key in the HTTP handler's response for the IC mainnet replicas. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15356
fix: hide root key in status HTTP endpoint

Merge branch 'mraszyk/refactor-get-msg-limit' into 'master'

chore: move fn get_msg_limit out of XNetPayloadBuilderImpl

This MR moves the function `get_msg_limit` out of `XNetPayloadBuilderImpl` so that it can be used when manually creating xnet payloads for tests using `StateMachine`. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15351
chore: move fn get_msg_limit out of XNetPayloadBuilderImpl

Merge branch 'mraszyk/large-testnet-config' into 'master'

fix: update large testnet topology

This MR updates the topology of the large Farm testnet. The reason for the update is that some consensus steps are skipped on 2-node subnets which have no fault tolerance (f=0). Hence, it makes sense to have a few 4-node subnets (f=1) and 1-node subnets (f=0). 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15328
fix: update large testnet topology

Merge branch 'mraszyk/should-accept-ingress-on-not-running' into 'master'

ingress messages to canisters that are not running are rejected before consensus

This MR adds a check that a canister receiving an ingress message is Running before the ingress message is accepted into the ingress pool. This is because update calls to Stopping/Stopped canisters are rejected anyway and thus it doesn't make sense to accept such an ingress message.

Interface Specification MR: https://github.com/dfinity/interface-spec/pull/233 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15241
ingress messages to canisters that are not running are rejected before consensus

Merge branch 'mraszyk/candid-0.9.9' into 'master'

Bump candid to the latest release 0.9.9.
