Merge branch 'martin/chore-http-utils-follow-redirects' into 'master'

chore(http-utils,file-downloader): follow redirect

This MR implements an http redirect for `FileDownloader::http_get()` in `rs/http_utils/src/file_downloader.rs`.

This would be the preferred solution for IDX to provide images like the upgrade image from different servers. We want to unify access to these servers behind a redirect server that responds with an http redirect.

**Note**: This redirect server runs in our Kubernetes clusters and could potentially be compromised. I assume that this should not be a problem since the image is verified with its hash. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!14041

commits.message:
Merge branch 'NA/NODE-140-second-part-scripts' into 'master'

feat(NODE-140): HostOS and GuestOS upgrade status reporting from boot scripts, second attempt

\[NODE-140\] Report HostOS upgrade status in various phases of the upgrade/boot scripts.

This is a second attempt (superseding the reverted https://gitlab.com/dfinity-lab/public/ic/-/merge_requests/14173) with adjusted permissions (in https://gitlab.com/dfinity-lab/public/ic/-/merge_requests/16029) and here `manageboot.sh` of GuestOS will unconditionally elevate its privileges.

1. HostOS metrics:
   1. Renamed `hostos_guestos_first_boot_state` to `hostos_first_boot_state` to avoid confusion.
   2. New `hostos_boot_stable` metric is "1" if the current boot has been confirmed and marked as stable, otherwise "0".
   3. New `hostos_first_boot_state` metric is "1" if the current boot is the first boot of a newly installed HostOS, otherwise "0".
   4. New `hostos_boot_action` metric is "1" if an explicit change has been made, otherwise "0" and has the following attributes depending on changes in boot flows or states:
      * `{successful_boot="true"}` if the HostOS boot has progressed up to starting GuestOS
      * `{confirm_boot="PARTITION_NAME",version="HOSTOS_VERSION_NAME"}` if a partition name (boot slot) has been explicitly confirmed as successfully booted. HostOS version string is the one on the currently booted filesystem.
      * `{next_boot="PARTITION_NAME",version="HOSTOS_VERSION_NAME"}` if a boot slot has been marked as failsafe after installing the upgrade. HostOS version string is the one on the currently booted filesystem.
      * `{written_boot="PARTITION_NAME"}` or `{written_root="PARTITION_NAME"}` if a boot slot has been written to by the upgrade script and `{written_var="true"}` if the `/var` partition has been wiped by the same script.
2. GuestOS metrics:
   1. New `guestos_boot_stable` metric is "1" if the current boot has been confirmed and marked as stable, otherwise "0".
   2. New `guestos_boot_action` metric is "1" if an explicit change has been made, otherwise "0" and has the following attributes depending on changes in boot flows or states:
      * `{successful_boot="true"}` if the GuestOS boot has progressed up to starting the replica
      * `{committed="true"}` if the previously written upgrade was committed (via the 'upgrade-commit' command of the script)
      * `{confirm_boot="PARTITION_NAME",version="GUESTOS_VERSION_NAME"}` if a partition name (boot slot) has been explicitly confirmed as successfully booted. GuestOS version string is the one on the currently booted filesystem.
      * `{next_boot="PARTITION_NAME",version="GUESTOS_VERSION_NAME"}` if a boot slot has been marked as failsafe after installing the upgrade. GuestOS version string is the one on the currently booted filesystem.
      * `{written_boot="PARTITION_NAME"} or {written_root="PARTITION_NAME"}` if a boot slot has been written to by the upgrade script and `{written_var="true"}` if the `/var` partition has been wiped by the same script.
3. Logging: similar for HostOS and GuestOS, reporting the same versions, slot names and boot actions as the metrics in the same places for emergency troubleshooting. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!16195
feat(NODE-140): HostOS and GuestOS upgrade status reporting from boot scripts, second attempt

Merge branch 'NA/launch-single-vm-farm-fixes' into 'master'

fix(NODE-1153): bring launch-single-vm metadata to Farm standard and use bazel cache URLs

In the Farm job metadata for, we now specify:
- user == `$HOSTUSER` of the devcontainer, or "unknown" if empty
- job_schedule == "manual" or CI job if available in the env vars
- test_name == `test_single_vm`
- group_name == `test_single_vm--1698081880388` where the last digits are milliseconds in unix epoch

In addition, we switch the `launch-remote-vm` task to using the bazel cache url as in `:disk-img.tar.zst.cas-url` instead of the CDN upload as it has been before. 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15581
fix(NODE-1153): bring launch-single-vm metadata to Farm standard and use bazel cache URLs

Merge branch 'NA/launch-single-vm-fixes' into 'master'

fix: allow running local IC-OS VMs without KVM support and doc updates

Duplicated the `launch-local-vm` build target into: 

```null
bazel run //ic-os/guestos/envs/dev:launch-local-vm-no-kvm
```

to allow running it in VMs/containers, and updated GuestOS readme to reflect the new names of the build targets, `launch-local-vm` and `launch-remote-vm` . 

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15409
fix: allow running local IC-OS VMs without KVM support and doc updates

Merge branch 'gary/gen1-setupos-hardware-fix' into 'master'

fix: NODE-1128 - Fix cpu thread detection for gen1 nodes

Fixed by increasing the expected gen1 thread count to 64. Testing pending. 

'''
The change in SetupOS hardware.sh detections (line and line) introduced in SAML single sign-on for DFINITY Lab  GitLab uses nproc to get the number of cores/threads/logical processors. On a Gen1 node, nproc returns 64 if SMT is enabled (which it is by default), but the script expects 32.

SMT is also enabled on our mainnet Gen1 fleet, so we should modify the script to calculate the number of cores/threads correctly to ensure that SetupOS still works on Gen1 machines correctly.
''' 

Closes NODE-1128

See merge request dfinity-lab/public/ic!15300

Merge branch 'SDK-1237-create-the-create-canister-endpoint-on-cmc' into 'master'

feat(SDK-1237): CMC: add create_canister to allow creating canisters using cycles

Closes SDK-1237

For the cycles ledger it is required that we can create canister on specific subnets using cycles. So far, only `notify_create_canister` offered this functionality, which requires ICP. This PR adds a `create_canister` endpoint to the CMC that offers the same functionality, but it accepts cycles. 

Closes SDK-1237
